title: half-awake grumbling

body:
*   On Wednesday night I told my boss at Soulless Corporate Megalith that I might not be in on Thursday and when he asked why I was honest with him and said I wasn't sure if I could get gas money sorted. He said well that is ridiculous, and loaned me $20 until payday so that I could come in. People are so nice sometimes!
*   Thursday was my Hell Day when I worked a lunch banquet at Enormous Downtown Venue through Temp Agency #2 and also had Soulless Corporate Megalith that night. I survived, and also? GOOD FOOD, OMG. It's kind of funny; when you work banquet service you're usually poor as hell and subsisting on ramen and then you go to work and eat like this:
 Figure One: Banquet in the break room! SO good!
*   Friday I slept all day. Like seriously, I got home from Soulless Corporate Megalith around 10:00 a.m., crashed, got up at 5:30 p.m., had dinner with my family, passed back out at 7 p.m., woke up for a few minutes around midnight when Hotter came to bed, and then went BACK to sleep until my alarm went off at six this morning. It felt like a total effing waste of my day off. Today was the first time in a long time that I wasn't dead on my feet though, so that was good.
*   Today I put in ten hours at Weekend Warrior Job, where they changed my name:
 Figure Two: This? Is not my name. "We couldn't find yours," management informed me, "but it's not like anyone cares what your name is anyway!" Thanks, boss! If you're wondering why they had my nametag, it's because we're not allowed to bring them home. We're not allowed to take uniform shirts off the premises either, so you have to show up, change into a hopefully-not-too-smelly-because-they-aren't-laundered-daily uniform shirt, work, and then take off your sweaty shirt and give it to management, who may or may not give it The Sniff Test right in front of you to decide whether some other poor sap has to wear the thing the next day. Um...yeah. If I had this job any more often I'd probably be irate, but honestly I find it kind of hilarious, because what else can you do with THAT?
*   I got home, ate ham and bean soup with the family, and...you guessed it. Passed out. And woke up an hour ago; the entire house is sleeping and since I have Soulless Corporate Megalith again tomorrow night (tonight, technically, as it's after midnight) I'm not sure if I should try and stay up so I can sleep during the day and be freshly rested or go back to sleep or what (yes, I could TOTALLY go back to sleep). 
*   My back is...not good. As in, I wake up first thing in the morning and have a little bit of trouble even walking while the NSAIDs kick in. No, I'm NOT supposed to take NSAIDs because of the bleeding thingy I have, and currently I'm afraid to so much as pluck a stray eyebrow hair or I'll bleed like a stuck pig, but it's "take NSAIDs, be able to walk and work, and be cautious around sharp objects" or "don't take the NSAIDs, not be able to walk or work, starve AND be in horrible pain while doing so" so I have therefore made the conscious decision to disregard medical advice on the matter. If worst comes to worst, every time I've had my H&H checked since recovering from my hysterectomy it's been stellar, a little on the HIGH side even, and so therefore I'm pretty confident that I can withstand a major bleed if I'm injured or something without it necessitating a transfusion.
*   And um...yeah. On THAT cheerful note I think I'll sign off. How are all of YOU?
 
P.S. The eggs did not hatch. Again. DAMN it. So next year we're definitely getting a bantam to be our broody hen.
title: not quite dead yet!

body:
This may come as a slight little shock to some of you, since I generally write about him like he can walk on water and poop Neapolitan ice cream, but Hotter is not perfect.
   The few (and they ARE few) times that we've had Issues I've been hesitant to share about that on here, both because I don't want to use my blog and its readers to triangulate in a marital dispute and also because I worry about what ridiculous spin Stalky and/or my ex-husband might try put on any hint of negativity on my part. Plus, in all honesty, Hotter is was (used to be?) pretty freaking awesome 99% of the time. I didn't want to put out a big angry rant sometime when I was peeved and have y'all think, based on my peevishness, that our marriage sucked or that he was a full-time dickhead.
   This time, though...well, I will PROBABLY regret this later, but I'm not so much caring about "fighting fair" or being a grownup, and I don't think there's anything potentially damaging to me in terms of custody or whatever about the beef du jour. I need to vent. So don't read any further unless you're a sane and rational person with at least fair-to-middling reading comprehension skills, okay?
   One of the Big Things that lead to the dissolution of my first marriage (not THE big thing, which I don't talk about on here, but it was BIG, so big that even the die-hard "save your marriage, think of the children, do you really want to throw away almost TEN YEARS?" people shut it with a swiftness if I shared it with them) was my ex-husband hacking me. As in, he works in network security and knows all of the unsavory things that nosy and/or exploitative people do to spy on others as part of his job, and proceeded to use those things on me. He put keystroke loggers on my old laptop (yeah, I got rid of the thing because I wouldn't have felt safe in using it no matter WHO tried to clean it up), and some kind of doohicky that let him remotely view and record whatever was going on on my screen, and it was creepy and unsettling and felt like a violation of my trust in letting him "fix" the computer for me. 
   Hotter knows this. He and I were good online friends for a couple of years before my separation and divorce, and we actually had our first telephone conversation as a direct result of the afore-mentioned hacking (the XY was accusing me of having an affair with Hotter, which I wasn't, I mean he lived four states away and we'd never so much as heard each other's voices until the accusations started to fly--I wanted to go over our previous talks online and didn't have access to all of that because I don't save such things, so I asked for his phone number from a public library). He knows how that whole thing made me feel.
   So why, I wonder, did Hotter evidently comb through my PayPal account (and Godiva only knows what else) to build a case for MFA Mama As Fiscally Irresponsible and All-Around Selfish Person? It wasn't quite so devious as hacking me; my laptop Has A Sick and I've used his computer a lot lately. I haven't been careful about leaving things open because I trust(ed) my current husband, I've checked the "store my password box," and hell, I've even used the same damn password for everything (and told Hotter as much). Because I am stupid like that and also because, again, I trust(ed) him.
   The stupid part is, if he'd let me explain a couple of things he would have understood that I was, in fact, thinking of our family's best financial interests. I mean hell, I don't do much else BESIDES that lately. Every trip to the grocery store is agony, every time we have an overdraft I feel like a failure, and every time I get a shut-off notice and can't do anything about it another little piece of me dies. But honestly? I don't even care to explain myself to Hotter at this point. He has done that thing that people do when are petty, immature jerks and have either a complaint with or just an incomplete understanding of someone else's actions and gone and created a SECOND problem (namely that of taking a wrecking ball to the trust I worked so hard to be able to have in him or really ANYONE after certain life events, and being a dick in the process). And if I even discuss this with him at this point a) my head will explode, b) he shows NO signs of wanting to hash it out as grownups, so it'll be unproductive at best and damaging to my kids (since SOME PEOPLE can't maintain decorum around small children) at worst and c) I'll feel like I'm bowing to/reinforcing his shady behavior by even discussing things I would have gladly told him had he asked, except noOOOooo, he didn't ASK, he SNOOPED. Plus, again, NOW? Not so much with the caring about setting him straight. Just call me the honeybadger, because I no longer give a shit. 
   I know that money problems are one of the leading causes of divorce, which is cold comfort when you find yourself married to someone who, rather than make things EASIER when your family is struggling, pisses money away on credit card fees you didn't even know about (OH YES, YES I DID GO THERE, HOTTER), attacks you for buying a $3.31 tub of pretzel sticks for your kids' school snacks when he's out of coffee and OMG COFFEE EMERGENCY, and gives you the LASER EYES OF PURE RAGE when you return from the store without cereal, because they are not a morning person and hate to cook in the morning. I have bitten my tongue again and again, reasoning that Hotter is under a lot of stress being essentially a solo parent while I'm nocturnal, and not used to being this poor. But today, after the cereal thing, I finally Said Something, and he came back with "DO YOU REALLY WANT TO START WITH THIS NOW?" like some kind of THREAT or something, and when I said maybe I did he proceeded to blast me with his creepyness, IN FRONT OF MY KIDS.
   Of course it's not really about the money (at least not for me). It's about the fact that he apparently thinks I'm selfish and I TOTALLY think I married a small, petty little man who can't control his ugliness in front of small children for the SECOND time in my life. Oh, and also that he doesn't seem to understand BOUNDARIES. Geez, that sounds kind of familiar too!
   I have no idea what I am going to do with this. If he apologized, probably I'd be willing to accept the apology and try to make the best of things, but that doesn't look very likely and barring a motherfucking PROFUSE apology I kind of think this is A Dealbreaker, which makes me very sad. On top of which, I have NO IDEA how I am going to provide for my kids if I can't work due to lack of childcare. If this is how it's going to be I'll just have to figure something out though, I guess, because life is too short to spend married to petty, trust-violating cocknozzles. Been there, done that.
   For tonight I guess I'll just go to work as usual and hope I get to hit things with hammers.
 
P.S. I have closed comments on this post, for I believe the first time in the history of this blog. I already know that it sucks and that this was a dick move on Hotter's part, and I already know ending a marriage isn't a decision to be entered into lightly, and I already know that life probably owes me a fucking break by now. I don't really want to give this any more headspace than I absolutely have to, though, so.

body:
In the comments on my earlier post, K. said something so wise and spot-on that I thought it bore repeating:
I want to say lots of things out loud about all of this because I consider you my friend and friends feel compelled to vent and rail and wonder aloud about nonsense done to those they care about. But...marriages are personal and complex and lovely and hurtful all in one bundle, so it feels like not my place to say any of those things. Instead know that I hope this hurdle of hurt is overcome smoothly for and by everyone.
   Yes. That. It's no wonder she's one of my favorite people on the innernet!
   Also Hotter pulled out the "I'm sorry BUT--" (which means the "not really" was silent like an e) and then the "I only did it because I come from a shitty family" (don't we all? CUE THE TINY VIOLINS!) and THEN?
   Then he came to me with a sheepish grin on his face holding the tweezers and said there was a tick on his nutsack. And while my initial reaction was "well isn't THAT a shame!" he then pointed out that if it got infected he'd have to go to the hospital FOR A LONG TIME. "Oh, damn, you'd be out of my hair? I'm liking this better by the moment!" I replied, but then he pointed out that I needed him for childcare and I grudgingly took the tweezers from him. "You REALLY want me to take these pointy things and mess with your nuts right now," I asked. "THAT IS HOW MUCH I TRUST YOU!" he said.
   So I removed the tick, and didn't even insist on using the match method,* because we don't have any matches in the house I'm a fucking saint. 
   Karma, however, is a bitch.
 
*   Do not attempt the match method of tick removal! It's a good way to burn the skin the tick is buried in, and might even cause the tick to vomit its stomach contents into your wound. Which...gross.

If you follow me on the Twitter, you may already be aware that a motherfucking spider bit me last night. I was planning on hitting the sheets early, and had been aware of a slight itch on my left calf for a while and thought maybe a flea from a dog at the hippie food coop had bitten me or something. As soon as I got in bed it became MUCH worse, and began to ache and burn and swell, and I had to get up and take a lot of pills and apply topical steroids and use my inhaler, then stayed up for about an hour after that to get relief and then ensure I'd avoided an anaphylactic reaction (been there, done that a few times).
   Today I found a (very part-time) job. I won't say anything about it except that it's exactly what I needed and about as close to a polar opposite of what I was doing before as it gets; if we're careful I think we may be able to get by with this until the season for it is over and then we'll see. I can at least look at more permanent solutions in the meantime and hopefully find one that won't be utterly soul-destroying.
   Also we do not (as far as I know) have magnesium sulphate PASTE here, but I did have Epsom Salts and mixed some of those with coconut oil and applied that gritty mixture to my heel, then stretched a nitrile exam glove over that. We'll see what happens...
P.S. In celebration, I went to the feed store and picked up two Jersey Giant chicks. We've named them Snooki and JWoww (and the sole surviving Orpington is now Blanche, who was always my favorite of the Golden Girls).

body:
So today I needed to go to the Post Office and mail a few things I sold on e-Bay, plus three packages of Trader Joe's Heart Healthy Whole-Grain Instant Blueberry Oatmeal that I bought to send to a certain tiny friend in Canada whose mother would very much like him to just EAT SOMETHING FOR THE LOVE OF GODIVA and who loves the stuff (no TJ's in Canada; Canada loses ten points). I usually prefer to use the automated machine-thingy in the lobby, and when I got there there was quite a line inside, so I decided to mail my domestic items via the machine in hopes the crowd would disperse a bit.
   As I was weighing my packages and entering Zipcodes I couldn't help but overhear three older, rather fat gentlemen conversing at the top of their lungs over by the Post Office Boxes.
Old Fat White Dude #1: --all the damn liberals' fault, most of these people don't even WANT to work!Old Fat White Dude #2: No, and don't want to pay their bills either! I got a building with twenty units in it, and half of 'em don't hardly pay their rent! I'm losing money like a sumbitch!Old Fat White Dude #3: Ayep, and it ain't gonna get no better 'til we get that dumb monkey outta the Whitehouse, America done lost its mind and now we ALL got to pay for it.
   Et. fucking. Cetera.
   It went on and on and ON, and a couple of times when they started in on the single mothers and the damn hippies and the overeducated damn fools clogging up the job market I ALMOST said something, but hey it's a free country and they can exercise their freedom of speech and freedom of assembly all they want, right? Grr...
   Finally I mailed the last domestic package and went inside and took my place in line, starting on a Customs declaration form. The three old fat white dudes brought their conversation inside and got in line behind me, continuing to yammer on about the got-damn immigrants taking all the jobs (two of the three clerks working the counter at the Post Office in question speak with heavy accents and looked distinctly pained). When the person in front of me was called I was still writing, and had a small crisis of conscience.
   See, I am a NICE PERSON and generally if I know I'm going to be a moment I'll let the person behind me go ahead, but behind me were three truly wretched examples of humanity. I was honestly tempted to let them stand there and fidget, but then I decided that if I treated them differently based on their political beliefs then I wasn't any better than they were.
   "Excuse me, sir, I'm still writing on this if you'd like to go ahead," I told Old Fat White Dude #1, and without so much as acknowledging me he went ahead of me, and SO DID THE OTHER TWO. Revenge was mine, however, because the Indian fellow behind the counter who was ready to help the next customer finished his transaction he pointed to me and said he was pretty sure I was next.
   So I went ahead and mailed my package, while Old Fat White Dudes 2 and 3 grumbled about you couldn't hardly expect no different from someone in an obscene t-shirt (my shirt today says FCKH8), and I guess the take-home lesson here is "don't bother trying to be polite to assholes."

*   Yesterday was a mercy-killing-free day.
*   It was also my big "solo at the helm" day over at the hippie food coop. I minded the store all by my lonesome for about three hours (the owners travel a couple of days a week doing CSA drops, foraging, lobbying, etc. and the one paid employee had to drive to another state on urgent business) and didn't burn the place down (GO, ME!). I effed up (maybe? I'm not even totally sure that I did) on one minor credit card transaction (think "less than five bucks"), and other than that I think I handled everything perfectly, which I think was better than any of us there expected. In gratitude the owners gave the MFAmily a CSA share, which was awesome as we can no longer afford to be members and have been missing it.
*   I am going to be helping another local business out with a banquet this weekend. Which requires that I buy some black pants that aren't of the yoga variety and a white button-down, but I'll be making enough for it to still be worth my while after clothes and gas. WHOO!
*   The MFA Children came home from Daddy Weekend with some type of upper-respiratory bug and immediately infected me (EFF). I had...what, maybe two weeks? Free of Asthmapalooza '10-'11 and inhaled steroids and prescription cough suppressants? And now I think I am headed in that direction once more, and my rib, which had been feeling MUCH better, is rather painful again. Shoot and heck and crap, y'all. I canNOT be coughing at the aforementioned banquet, for obvious reasons.
*   The surviving chicks are now eating over a pound of starter feed per day, all nine of their insubstantial little selves. It's crazy!
*   I have EIGHT baby cauliflowers. EIGHT.
*   The splinter I have had lodged in my heel for...um, well, it's been a minute, I think this splinter (or possibly it's glass of some sort?) celebrated the winter holidays with us...anyway this thing in my heel is rather painful lately, and I've already tried home surgery a FEW times with no success; I can SEE the thing under the skin (it's like a dot drawn by a very sharp pencil--TINY) but the instant I attempt its removal my stupid bleeding disorder takes this as its cue to turn things to eleven, which makes visibility poor and grasping anything in there nigh on to impossible (I can now honestly say it generates a loss of blood volume comparable to slaughtering a chicken). I've soaked my feet half to death on multiple occasions, tried the Vaseline/Band-Aid trick, all of that crap...what does one do in such a case, short of going to the doctor, which seems ludicrous over a gee-dee splinter?
*   The XY is recently writing all sorts of high flown appeal-to-emotion-y E-mails Of Ostentatious Crap About How Life Is Too Short (to impress his girlfriend? To hold up in Imaginary Custody Court?) about co-parenting classes (which I first begged for, then insisted upon, then gave up on and now cannot afford--don't worry, I've told him that if he pays I and even Hotter will be there, which ought to table the issue). As evidence of their necessity he informed me that two people (one about twenty-two years old, one a decade or so older than I am) who were "the product of divorce" were recently dead, one of a DUI-vs.-utility pole scenario and the other over "an allergic reaction to a medication with liver complications" (sounds like an o-v-e-r-d-o-s-e to me). "THINK ABOUT IT," his most recent missive exhorted me. I find this rather offensive, as both of the people in question (friends of HIS, not mine) were wretchedly unpleasant sluts whose custodial parents were useless deadbeats, and my kids don't have THAT problem (and yes, I told the XY as much). By all accounts I hear the MFA Children are very well-adjusted and the only dysfunction and unseemliness in their lives comes from the XY's direction, and you don't see ME peeing in HIS yard or contributing to getting HIM fired, so I'm not quite sure what he thinks he's getting at in the first place, although I AM sure I've had just about enough of whatever it is.
*   How are all of YOU?

body:
*   Hotter apologized at some point yesterday while I was attempting to sleep (actually I was succeeding until he woke me--PARTY FOUL, dude! If you decide to stay mad while your insomniac wife cries herself to sleep, at least let her wake up on her own before you apologize!). I don't even remember if I said anything or not before falling back to sleep, but I had anxiety dreams after that until the alarm went off, about things like getting an invoice for repairs to Casa MFA that I had no memory of, but dire things were going to happen if I didn't pay it, and getting my oldest (who was a teenager in the dream) his first cell phone, which was promptly canceled for nonpayment of some ridiculous four-figure sum, and GEE DO YOU THINK I AM FREAKING OUT ABOUT MONEY? When my alarm went off, Hotter was all up in my grille wanting to tell me a funny story about the poultry and I grunted a couple of times, then as I was on my way out the door he was all "I loooove youuuu" and I was all *slam* I love how he seems to have completely forgotten that anything is wrong. Oh, wait, no I don't, it irritates the FUCK out of me!
*   I debated calling in sick but went to work anyway, figuring I would be just as miserable if not more so if I stayed home but wouldn't be paid for furious cleaning here. Everygoddamnbody proceeded to get on my nerves, with their stupid smiling faces and entreaties to "SMILE, IT AIN'T THAT BAD." OH YEAH? MAYBE IT MOTHERFUCKING IS AND FURTHERMORE FUCK OFF AND DIE IN A FIRE! Yeah, it was like that. In the break room, some asinine smiling mofo announced chirpily that "you're like, BURIED IN YOUR PHONE." I went with "mm-hmm" instead of what I wanted to say, which was "YES, IT MEANS THAT I DON'T WANT TO TALK TO ANYONE," and got a further three minutes of "so whatcha DOIN?" and "blogs, huh?" and "d'ya think it'll rain today?" for showing such restraint. I don't really know why I'm not more of a bitch to people. Nobody seems to worry about hurting MY goddamn feelings, and being nice gets you NOWHERE in life.
*   If you follow me on the Twitter, you may have already seen my lunch-break freakout. Basically I was hungry, but didn't want to buy anything for myself to eat because I didn't feel like hearing about whether SOMEone thought that was a selfish purchase or not, and whined a whole lot. Gee, if you don't already follow me on the Twitter I don't know WHAT you're waiting for!
*   Because I don't have enough to worry about, Soulless Corporate Megalith announced that they're canning half the temps, but wouldn't say which ones. Apparently they're going to give Temp Agency #1 a list and have them do the dirty work via telephone sometime today. Awesome! Not!
*   Bottom line, I am in a foul frame of mind today and honestly I think Hotter just apologized because he wants this to go away and/or realized after reading my last post that I wasn't going to shrug it off, not because he actually feels like what he did was all that wrong or has changed his mind about me being a selfish and irresponsible person (or maybe he has--I'm generally only selfish and irresponsible if he is out of coffee, which he still is, so...I dunno. Used to be I was selfish and irresponsible if he was out of cigarettes but then his doctor and I made him quit, them because they worried about him dying of lung cancer and me because I was worried I'd snap and kill him myself...maybe if I decide against divorcing his arse he needs to give up coffee?). As for the level of wrongness, it's not like I have Things To Hide; it's more like this was all a little too Shades Of My Ex-Husband, plus I am sick and goddamn tired of his trying to make our poverty MY fault every time he's hating it extra-much. I get the urge to try and make it a fuckup on someone's part, because then it would go away if that person would only QUIT fucking up, but that's bad logic unless someone is actually fucking up (by oh, I don't know, paying a bunch of stupid-assed credit-card fees the other party doesn't know about? SOMEthing like that.). The repeated assurances that "I only looked at your PayPal account, not like, your e-mails or other private stuff!" and the way I keep tripping up when entering my new password are not helping me be any less rage-y about the whole thing. READ MY E-MAILS IF YOU WANT. THE POINT IS NOT THAT I HAVE ANYTHING TO HIDE, IT'S THAT YOU CREEPED ME THE FUCK OUT, DUDE. I guess I also kind of wonder if his recent notion that I am untrustworthy means he's Up To No Good his own self in some way I don't yet know about and projecting. I really hope that's not it because I am about one shitty revelation away from climbing a motherfucking clocktower.
*   I'm going to go and make breakfast for the troops, because GODIVA FORBID anyone give me any shit about there not being cereal, I will SERIOUSLY end up on the news. I'm going to attempt to let Hotter sleep in, mostly so I don't have to deal with him in front of the children. Wish me luck.

title: this is getting downright depressing

body:
*   As I've previously mentioned, we have an escape-artist duck. One of the females (presumably the one that's been laying, as we haven't gotten ANY duck eggs since she started escaping!) gets out EVERY SINGLE MORNING. We put her in at night, and in the morning we find her outside the pen quacking and hungry. Probably she's got a secret nest somewhere, but we have no interest in baby ducks and MUCH INTEREST in further delicious duck-egg cakes, so this is pretty obnoxious on her part. Last night we locked all of the ducks into the original MFA Coop, which is a cedar and hardware-cloth enclave that we THOUGHT was unescapable. Apparently not, though, because Houducki pried the sliding door to the nesting-box part the chickens lay in open, hopped up into that, and then made her way into "Genpop" from whence she escaped (somedamnhow; we don't know how she does it and she's the only one, and yes, we DO know that it's the SAME one, because I clipped her head feathers for easy identification). Do you know that it takes at least two people (if they're both adults, and three or more if you're using children as chasers) to catch one escaped duck? Hotter dragged me from my deathbed this morning to help corral our wee quacking convict. "I'd butcher her, but look how cute, with the one crap-flap slapping," I said, holding Houducki up for his inspection as she did her trademark one-foot-waggle. "Plus she's the one who lays. I want more duck-egg cakes!" Hotter said, grudgingly stroking her little cropped head. Then we tossed her back into the pen like that would accomplish anything. I dunno. We've clipped her wings, plugged all visible holes...my next brilliant idea is to saw a length of broom-handle to "lock" the sliding nestbox door. Stay tuned!
*   I still haven't seen the male turkey (a.k.a. "Loud and Crazy;" he's named after Hotter's brother) puff up and strut, but Hotter has, and he's also seen Paul the Rooster and Loud and Crazy facing off! And Paul won, despite being on the smaller side even for a chicken! GO PAUL! Hotter said it wasn't actual fighting so much as aggressive posturing and chest-bucking, but I would have liked to see that. Apparently Loud and Crazy went running like a little punk-ass bitch. Haha!
*   The four Wyandottes, a.k.a. "the Chic-tacs," appear to be bantams. I say this because they're...not growing. They make up for their tiny stature in pure viciousness, however. NOBODY fucks with the Wyandottes. Not the turkeys, not the Jersey Giants, not Paul, and not even Hotter since one flew up and clawed his leg (drawing BLOOD!). They move around in a black-and-white miniflock like ninjas, flapping and hopping animatedly and exuding a palpable menace. Seriously, they're bad news! Yesterday I clipped their wings so they couldn't pull anymore Matrix-moves on Hotter, and the snarling sounds of fury they produced as I captured them (with great difficulty) and snipped their flight feathers were...well, they were quite something. When it became apparent that they were bantams, I had high hopes of using one or more of them as broody-hens, but...I dunno. They don't seem very maternal. More like they'd eat their young...AND YOURS, TOO!
*   Poultry, they're assholes! And their assholery is contagious! Hotter said that either Snooki or JWoww seemed like she wanted to lay, and was trying to get into Genpop and use their nesting boxes (Cell Block C also has a nesting box, but it's not as cushy). I suggested that he add more straw to Cell Block C's nesting box and he said he was going to, and also that he was trying to figure out a way to raise it up "so it'd be more like a tree." I said wild chickens were ground-nesters, he said there WERE no wild chickens, and it was ON! Google tells me that there ARE SO wild chickens--see? The Red Junglefowl, a.k.a. Gallus gallus. TOTALLY different from the domestic chicken (Gallus gallus domesticus). I read all of that out loud to Hotter, smugly. "OMG I'm gonna punch you!" he exclaimed. Some people just HATE TO BE WRONG! Also, I want a Red Junglefowl or three. 
*   I'm sick and slightly delirious and if it wasn't Sunday I'd go to the doctor. It's THAT BAD. How are all of YOU?
title: poultry, they're assholes!

body: The XY returned the MFA Children late this morning, as usual, which was fine because Hotter and I slept until ten and it was glorious. We had just taken MFA Puppy outside for her morning wee and some breakfast (we feed her on the porch currently) when the XY-mobile rolled up and the MFA Children poured out. "Here you go, it's XY-puppy's time of the month so Big Child has some questions for you!" said the XY, grinning like an asshole.   "Aw thanks a LOT, why didn't you get that damn dog spayed?" I groaned (the MFA Children had stampeded straight into the house to kiss their game systems hello).   "That's not the issue! You need to talk to your son about this--I told him it was a woman-thing."   "But humans and dogs are completely opposite, they bleed when they're ready to mate, I don't even know WHY dogs bleed--you're a dick, have I ever told you that?" Hotter swatted me, because apparently he's my dad now. I sighed, and gritted my teeth, forcing a smile. "Probably for the best, since you told him babies and pee come out of the same hole in humans." Which he totally did.   "Have fun with that!" the XY said, unfazed, still grinning, and got in his car.   "So Big Child, when a mommy grows up and decides she wants some babies, she marries very poorly--" I yelled as the XY backed out of the driveway. He waved jauntily.   So yeah, Big Child is waiting, and Hotter is exclaiming in disgust over something he already found online, and...dammit. HAPPY MONDAY, Y'ALL!

*   I bought some bath salts from the hippie food coop today, because they smell fantastic. title: updates, various

body:
This morning I wrapped up my very last shift at Soulless Corporate Megalith.
   Thank goodness.
   I'm going to miss the paycheck, but I won't miss the moral queasiness, the heinous accidents, the threats of cutting from shady co-workers.
   For those of you who were wondering, yes, I did get the chance to forgive Scarface out loud. She was nonplussed, and insisted that she was not EITHER full of hate! But she left me alone after that.
   Toward the end of the shift, we were all working frantically on The Steel Structure (yes, the one that fell on the man). Management had determined that it was four inches (yes, you read that right) off of "print" and that we needed to move it again. The Supervisor Who Enjoys My Arse said no way, no how was he asking anyone to push the thing by hand, and so we dismantled it, piece by piece, in sections, moving the parts of each one the four inches over before reassembling it. That wasn't going fast enough, though, and so Management called on all of us to go and find as many of the very pieces of equipment they had stated were not rated for indoor use in blaming the injured man for his own misfortune as possible, to use indoors to move the thing.
   As we were slipping the equipment into place, someone mentioned that it was seven o'clock. "Y'all stay," said The Big Boss. Then, realizing that as of seven we could leave if we so chose, rephrased it as a request. "If you can? Please? Maybe we can all pitch in, and you can earn some overtime?" I looked up at the towering Steel Structure, and at the equipment that was (still) not rated for indoor use, and decided the money wasn't worth the risk.
   On my way out the automatic doors, I heard a crash and a scream behind me. 
   I didn't look back.
title: goodbye and good riddance

body:
I woke up for the second or third time this morning to screaming, shrieking, HORRIBLE SOUNDS, and staggered out into the hallway, colliding with Hotter. "WHAT THE HELL?!?" I barked, all raspy. He pointed mutely into the littles' room. I opened the door to find Little Child mid-hissy.   "WHAT IS WRONG?"   "Big Child said he would start the movie without me when I went to ask Hotter if breakfast was ready! HE SAID HE WOULD START WITHOUT ME!" He pointed his face at the ceiling and wailed, fat tears rolling down his baby-fat cheeks.   "BIG CHILD!" Big Child, lying on a heap of boy-detritus on the floor, twisted around to look at me over his shoulder. Suddenly he has a four-inch 'fro.   "Yeah Mommy?"   "DON'T START THE MOVIE WITHOUT HIM!"   "I didn't!"   "Don't SAY you're going to start it without him, either, just to upset him. I know how you roll!"    "Okaaaay."   "Better, Little Child?"    Little Child nodded.    I limped into the kitchen (remember that splinter-thing? I still have it. Yes, it's TOTALLY ridiculous and if I were rich I'd go to a doctor of some sort, but oh well) and looked at Hotter, who started laughing, presumably at the look on my face. "He does that a lot," he offered.   "I WAS EXPECTING TO SEE HIS ARM LYING ON THE DAMN FLOOR!" We both laughed, and I stepped into his arms. "My throat hurts," I said into his shoulder, "I feel like I'm getting sick."   "Not surprising, the boys all have colds."   "WHAT!?! How did I not know that?"   "You haven't been home."
   Welcome back?

body: If you haven't already read about what's going on with MFA Puppy, here is a link. The donate button seems to be up and running again, and is located at the bottom right (scroll down if you don't see it--I didn't want it to be the first thing people saw when they came here but it's there if you look!).   Here is where we stand currently:*   Y'all are awesome. We now have approximately 35% of the full cost of treatment to hopefully eradicate these fucking mites! This is particularly excellent in that the weekly treatments are billed one at a time, so we've got enough to at least get started on treating her aggressively, and hopefully we'll be able to gather the rest as we go along. Middle Child has gallantly contributed the contents of his piggy bank ("I haff enough coins to make a dollar!") to help save the dog.*   As far as how our girl is doing, yesterday I was able to purchase at least SOME of the meds she will need and get her started on the road to recovery! The lumps on her neck, back, and flanks (which we now know are full of staph--YUCK!) have already gone down by at least half with the help of strong antibiotics (Cefphopodoxime, for the curious), which she will have to take for two weeks, although she's still rather bumpy if you run your hand down her body. She is also on a three-week course of oral Ivermectin (in liquid form--apparently not very yummy judging by her reaction to the stuff) to start killing the mites, and Benadryl (1 mg. per pound of bodyweight) three times a day to help control the itching. This makes her a bit stoned, but given the shape she's in currently that might not be such a bad thing!*   The rest of the treatment she needs will consist of weekly Mitaban dips (the vet said she'll most likely need five of these, although they'll do more skin scrapings to monitor her progress and depending on how those look she may need more treatment). These treatments have to be done at the vet (for two reasons--one, this stuff is really toxic and they don't want us using it in our home since we have children and two, this stuff is really toxic and Isis is a bit young to be on it, so they want to treat her first thing in the morning and monitor her for signs of an adverse reaction throughout the day; if she does okay we can take her home at dinner-time).*   The cost of all of this...oy. The good news is that we have Isis enrolled in the local Banfield Pet Hospital's "Optimum Wellness Plan" (she has the one in the right-hand column, which covers a bit more than the one in the left-hand column), so we don't pay a consultation fee for each visit itself AT ALL and we get 10% off of prescriptions for her. We also pay a "member rate" for diagnostic procedures including skin scrapings (without the plan it would have cost $142 yesterday for the appointment and skin scraping, but with the plan we only paid $52 for that and a total of $63 for the two prescriptions, although I need to get more Ivermectin, because I only had enough on me for ten days' worth yesterday).*   The rest of the treatment will consist of weekly Mitaban dips and at least two more skin scrapings. The cost (to us, at the member rate) of each Mitaban dip will be about $45 (this includes the drug itself, the dip treatment, and the day's monitoring, and a HAZMAT disposal fee).*   So the total cost of treatment (in addition to what we've already spent) is about $300 if she responds as predicted. If not, it could be more, but hopefully not MUCH more. It may not sound like much, but we budget down to the last dime here between regular household bills and Hotter's transplant meds, plus Little Child just got new glasses and last month we spent about $350 on getting Isis through that godawful GI bug (which we had to pay full cost to treat, as they would not enroll her in the wellness plan with a "pre-existing condition") and enrolling her in the Wellness Plan after she recovered (there's a one-time charge of $99 for that, after which it is $24.95/month).*   Right now Isis is pretty itchy and miserable in between doses of Benadryl, so I'm going to cut up an outgrown t-shirt of Little Child's and attempt to alter it to fit her to hopefully minimize the chewing she's been up to and cover her bald spots (right now in addition to the little spot above her eye that you can see in the picture I posted yesterday and a few isolated ones on her forelegs she's got a large-ish patch on the back of her neck and down her back that is losing hair, and her fur seems to be thinning all over her body; the vet said that unfortunately as the mites die in her hair follicles she may lose a lot more hair before we start to see visible improvement, although as I said the lumps she was getting already look a lot better). I'll post a picture if I am successful.*   As for the breeder, the mama dog, and Isis's eleven littermates (none of whom have sold yet--can't imagine why not)...the mama dog did have a flare-up when the pups were born (which the breeder swore was NOT mange), and the breeder weaned the pups early due to medications she was on (he said just antibiotics, but I suspect it was more than that, as she now has fur again). The breeder has pictures of the rest of the litter on his site, and I can detect signs of early mange infestation on four of them. I plan to turn him in to the county for running an unlicensed kennel the MOMENT those puppies hit sixteen weeks (the age by which all dogs must be licensed here). Sigh.

body:
Today (last night? Whatever the hell, I haven't slept yet) sucked.
   It started out with a day of poor sleep (I am out of Mirapex, the drug I take for Restless Legs Syndrome, and while I don't know for a fact that that is to blame, I kept having horrible nightmares and waking myself up hitting or kicking the wall beside the bed), and then on my way to work I called the XY to ask if he could pay the child support before noon so that I could deposit it before going to sleep today. He then proceeded to scream at me, because Big Child evidently told him at the last dinner visit that his teacher had had to buy him some posterboard to do a school project because Mommy didn't have the money for it and also that he thought I was short on money because we haven't had dessert lately and I had to tell him a couple of times that he couldn't have seconds at dinner. Oh, and that I was killing the chickens for meat and it made him sad. The XY was pissed because he says Big Child is "going around telling his teacher and everyone that he's poor." I don't know what to do with this, because none of what Big Child told the XY (or his teacher? I don't know what he told his teacher or whether the XY talked to the teacher or not, although I definitely owe her a thank-you note) was untrue. Maybe I shouldn't have told Big Child I didn't have the money for the posterboard, but our account was overdrawn that entire week and I couldn't think of a way to not buy him the posterboard and explain myself that would have been any less damaging to him than the truth. As I asked the XY (and I'm also asking y'all, because I don't know what the hell to do with this), would it have been better to say "oops, forgot, maybe tomorrow" and string him along letting him think his mother just forgot about his project? Say it was because he made his brother cry and make it like a punishment? Tell him I was just too busy and let him think he's not a priority? I don't like telling the kid we're broke, but it's not like he hasn't noticed and the truth seemed like the least hurtful thing to tell him. That doesn't mean hearing the XY put my inability to provide better for my children despite a current total of three jobs I am actively working into loud, accusatory words didn't cut like a knife or that I didn't cry like a little bitch, because I did. That miserable conversation was a new low, and I also cry easily when I'm off the Synthroid (which I am also out of) and/or skipping meals and right now both of those things are factoring into my mood. Did I fuck up, though, as a mother, by telling the kid I couldn't afford the posterboard? The XY clearly thinks so but he...is biased. And also not the most qualified judge in my OR the county's opinion of what is and isn't good parenting, or he wouldn't have lost his weekend visitation (yeah, I was trying not to tell y'all that because while Stalky is not my ex-husband, Stalky does love to accuse me of slandering my ex-husband and making up everything I've ever said about the guy online, but the observant among you will have noticed that the MFA Children aren't having Away Weekends anymore and that I haven't been smited by the courts over it, so. Yeah. I will go ahead and state that the CURRENT lack of Away Weekends is NOT a result of the XY causing any of the MFA Children direct physical harm with his hands or any type of implement, mostly so that Stalky doesn't try to say that I'm accusing the XY of that currently, but that's all I'll say about it, except that having to feed the MFA Children for four extra days per month is hosing our grocery budget). So...what say ye on the matter of whether I have erred in my parenting? I'm genuinely asking your opinions; if they're not something I'll enjoy hearing, well, I'm a big girl (my demeanor today notwithstanding) and I moderate comments in case anyone (aHEM, Stalky) goes all needlessly off-topic and ad hominem.
   So yeah, I showed up at work looking like I had been recently bawling, and everyone wanted to know why, and in order to avoid further waterworks on my part I just said "this is just my face today, don't pay it any mind," but I think people worried when I proceeded to weep quietly every time a socket wrench wouldn't turn without a hammer and someone else had the hammer, or I saw a little kid (lots of people shop with their little kids at midnight on the first of the month, because that's when their food stamps hit their EBT debit cards) or a grocery item we particularly need (because it's a special kind of hell to work in a superstore where rows and rows of everything your family doesn't have and needs are staring you in the face while you move shelves, especially if you skipped lunch), or I got my finger pinched in the folding cross-braces that attached to the wheel units we were jacking shelves of product up onto in order to move them during the ongoing renovation.
   It was pretty embarrassing, and I'm glad I'm a temp and don't have to worry about any of these peoples' longterm opinion of me. I seriously couldn't control it, and normally I am NOT LIKE THAT, not even a little bit. In fact prior to today (last night? Yesterday? Whatever) I could count the times I'd actually shed tears in 2011 on one hand and still have a finger free to flip someone the bird with (and two of those were in the past month of suckdom). Oh well.
   If you're wondering why I'm not sleeping right now, incidentally, that would be because the XY is on his way to pay the child support and I need to get that into the bank before I crash. But he overslept, and allegedly there was also a work emergency, and then also he had car trouble (plus he's never been able to tell the difference between ten minutes and an hour in predicting his arrival somewhere--it used to drive me insane when we'd be in the car and he'd tell someone "we'll be there in ten minutes! Wait for us!" while we were at least half an hour away). He said he'd be here at eight and currently it's a quarter to eleven. I hate him extra-much today and really hope I can at least not cry in front of him when he gets here, although who am I kidding, I'm uncomfortably certain that I will (dammit).
   I'm so goddamned tired, y'all.
   On the bright side, I've lost a ton of weight lately and am almost back into my skinny jeans, and also today when I arrived at work in furious tears I actually got to demolish shit with a mallet for money, and it was so fucking sweet that I cried when we were done breaking down old shelving units and I had to give the tools back (sigh).
   Also, the funny for the day: about forty-five minutes ago a police cruiser came down our street (we live in a quiet little cul-de-sac), back up it, and then another arrived and they both stopped in the middle of the road to talk at length at the end of my driveway. Finally I walked down and asked them what was going on, figuring that if this was some fresh hell and they were coming to take me away (haha) I'd just get it over with (also Middle Child is home sick for the second day in a row and my kids have seen enough of the police to last QUITE A WHILE thanks to my ugly, ugly divorce and their father's subsequent mental breakdown). I mean, I haven't broken any laws or anything, but with my luck...? Anyway I asked them if something was going on in the neighborhood and they said someone had reported a suspicious person but they'd checked and hadn't seen anything. I said "oh okay, thank you, and in that case could I ask a favor of you? My ex, who is usually guilty of SOMEthing, is on his way over here to pay the child support and if he sees two cruisers I'm worried he'll jet and I really need that check, so would you mind...?" They recognized me (yes, the local police force knows us, sadly) and laughed and said no problem, we'll skedaddle. Heh.
   How are all of YOU?

*   Thanks for the great comments so far on my last post. Two of you in a row prefaced yours with something along the lines of "dunno that I'm qualified to remark on this as I don't have kids..." and I wanted to clarify that I was indeed asking for EVERYONE'S opinions. Whether you've had kids or not, all of y'all have at some point BEEN kids who HAD parents and I don't think one needs to have children to comment on whether or not someone is effing up as a parent. I'm especially interested to hear what those of you with divorced parents have to say about things, as my own parents (stupidly) stayed together until I was an adult. So comment away, children or none!
*   A couple of y'all have suggested that I put up a "Donate" button. If anyone is specifically LOOKING for a "Donate" button, the little doodad on the upper right sidebar that says "Tip Jar: Change is Good" is the same thing (anything thrown in there goes into my PayPal account). I guess a PayPal "Donate" button would be more obvious, but I feel like a button that says "Donate" is asking for something, whereas a Tip Jar is instead more like "hey, if you enjoy this blog here's a way to tip your blogger." I don't tell y'all about the ugly things in my life because I want y'all to feel like you ought to donate money, though, it's more like I have to tell SOMEbody besides poor, longsuffering Hotter or my head will explode. Also, the only time I've ever put up a "Donate" button (back when Isis had the mange and we couldn't afford to treat it) Stalky went NUTS and started a bunch of Twitter accounts for the purpose of talking smack on me, and there seems to be an entire cadre of trolls who delight in picking on anyone who has a Donate button up and accusing them of faking or exaggerating. I'm not saying that folks who do go with a PayPal "Donate" button are doing those things, just that I a) don't want anyone who comes here to read for the hell of it to feel like I'm asking them for anything and b) am leery of doing anything that would get the trolls of the world any more het up over me than they already are.
*   Yeah, I'm obviously not asleep. I don't know why that is. I'm certainly exhaused and the XY finally did show up with the child support check (I DIDN'T CRY! WHOO TITS!, but...eh. body:
I woke up this morning wheezing with a crushing headache, and went to work anyway, because thanks to a couple of innernet fairy-godmothers I now possess a nebulizer and Albuterol amps so I was able to fix the wheezing, and the headache sucked hard but wasn't a migraine or anything (no visual disturbances, photophobia, nausea, dizziness or sense of imminent doom) (plus I hadn't had a migraine proper in AGES, although I used to get them regularly before I got my thyroid levels straight) (that's called foreshadowing--I've been off the Synthroid due to poverty, remember?).
   I left Casa MFA a few minutes early, because I had errands to run. I had to get to the bank to make a deposit before banking hours started, and while we can ill afford the retail price of a single energy drink, I decided to declare a state of emergency due to the ferocity of the headache, in the hopes that a jolt of caffeine would kill it and liven my arse up a little in general. Waiting at a light to make the turn from Main Street MFA County into the shopping center where my bank is located, I saw a hound dog dart into traffic, nearly get hit (at which point I swear I suffered a small heart attack), dart the other way, stop just short of disaster, elude a man who'd gotten out of his truck to call to it, and then weave back onto the sidewalk and trot right past a screaming woman.
   I made my turn and was about to get out of the MFA Minivan at the bank when here came the hound, baying excitedly, with the woman in hot pursuit. I was now close enough to see that she was barefoot and in tears. I sprinted out of the MFA Minivan and up the hill from the bank parking lot, cutting the hound off before he went back toward the main drag, and he bayed fiercely and launched himself at my ankles, latching onto my tuxedo pants. The woman took advantage of this pause in the forward motion to grab the hound and looked up at me, horrified. "I was the one who got in his way, it's just the pants," I said at the same moment as she began apologizing profusely. That settled, she looked down at the dog. "YOU COCKSUCKING ASSHOLE MOTHERFUCKER! I FUCKING HATE YOU YOU DICK!" she bellowed, patting the dog on the head, and limped awkwardly back in the direction they'd come from, leading the dog by his collar bent over and cursing a blue streak. I examined the tear in my pants-leg and considered calling out sick in light of that and the headache and now the lack of time for buying the headache any caffeine, but decided my arse needed to work unless I was dead.
   I felt kind of funny on the way into work, kind of pukey and jittery-strange, but decided it was adrenaline from the chase and my near-mauling. I was spacey and off-kilter, and I'm afraid I was of virtually no use at all to my co-workers in setting up for a high-school reunion and serving the luncheon. Right as we were busing the tables in preparation for some sort of ceremony during which the client wanted waitstaff off the floor, two things happened: all of the symptoms I normally have as a migraine aura descended on me at once and a marching band in uniform marched into the banquet hall playing Stars and Stripes Forever at full volume.
   It was like a commercial for a new and wondrous prescription migraine treatment, except no cheesy spokesperson came to my rescue with a magic pill. I had to chase down my boss and tell him in no uncertain terms that I needed to leave, and drive myself the forty-five minutes home, except it ended up taking an hour.
   Because I got pulled over and got ANOTHER motherfucking "you're-too-poor-to-update-your-registration-so-here's-an-expensive-ticket" ticket.
   I shouldn't have fucking gotten out of bed today. And how are all of YOU?

body: So. Yesterday I took MFA Puppy for her first Mitaban dip treatment for the mange (thank you so much to everyone who helped make that possible).   It. Was. AWFUL!   I'm glad I had read all about Mitaban and its side effects before Isis's first treatment, because that stuff pretty much kicked her ass and if I hadn't been kind of expecting at least SOME adverse effects I would have been even more freaked out than I was (I mean, looking back that doesn't seem possible, but I never doubt the ability of bad things to be get even worse anymore, heh heh heeeeghhhhh...).   When I picked her up from the vet Isis's eyes were very watery and she seemed a little dopey, but I figured she'd act better in familiar surroundings and be like that for an hour or two at most. After all, the vet had examined her and determined that she was fine to go home, so how bad could it be, right?   Well, pretty damned bad, as you may already know if you follow me on the Twitter. Not only was the poor dog acting like a drunk (complete with swaying on her feet and staring blankly around her at nothing), but she also refused to drink (fortunately she still had a good appetite--she's a freak for that canned prescription diet--and we added some reduced-sodium chicken broth to her meals to give her a bit more liquid), swelled up hugely, seemed constipated (she only pooped twice yesterday, and this is a dog who usually poops at least twice after EVERY SINGLE ONE of her three daily meals and usually a couple times in between, too) and unable to pee (she kept squatting but peeing only a few drops, if at all), and her vision seemed to be affected (judging by the blank staring and the fact that when we took her out after the sun went down she pretty much refused to move, cowering fearfully, unless you got right up in her face and then she'd act all surprised to see you, and greet you like you'd just come back from being gone). She slept most of the day (and SNORED, which is not something she's ever done before; it almost sounded like her breathing was labored), and then this morning she woke up and was (thankfully) at a solid 85%. She did her usual morning routine of stretching, yawning, then coming up from the foot of the bed to lick our faces and fling herself into my arms, then Hotter's arms, then my arms again, laying her head on our pillows and generally being a ham.    When we threw the blankets back to get up, though, we noticed that she'd wet the bed. Huh. She does NOT generally have accidents in the house, and I'm glad we didn't scold her because when I took her outside she peed a puddle the size of her entire body, then walked a few feet and did it again. I guess maybe the stuff made her retain water? She's not bloated anymore and is definitely a couple of pounds lighter than she was yesterday, so that's our theory. She's still a little unsteady in her gate, but only if you're looking closely, and she's bouncing around and being her usual happy, playful self.   The vet decided to space out her treatments to one dip every TWO weeks rather than a dip a week after observing her reaction, and apparently most dogs who have a hard time with the drug do better with subsequent treatments, so hopefully this won't happen again (if it does I'm going to have a really hard time putting her through it over and over)! We got a bit of a surprise in that the dips are slightly more expensive than I thought ($86 yesterday because we had to buy the bottle of dip plus pay for the treatment process itself--next time it'll be $45 because each bottle of dip contains enough for two rounds), but probably I just didn't pay very good attention when they initially explained it to me because I was so stunned and distraught over the diagnosis itself, so my bad (I am not putting the donate button back up--it'll probably end up being about a hundred bucks more than I thought all together, but we can tighten our belts around here and absorb that cost without failing to meet any of the human family members' needs, especially since the cost will be spread out over a couple of months).    In case anyone was curious, the vet said that we can skip the monthly heartworm preventative this month (since Ivermectin is the active ingredient and Isis is on a daily dose of that for the next three weeks), but to keep using the flea stuff (Frontline), and that we'll have to hold off on spaying Isis until after her treatment is complete as the Mitaban can interact with anesthesia drugs. The spaying itself CAN cause a relapse (from the stress of surgery), but hopefully not, and they may put her back on a prophylactic course of Ivermectin after her surgery to help prevent that from happening. It's VERY important that we DO spay her, though, as the stress of going through heat cycles can bring on relapses as well, and dogs who have had demodectic mange really shouldn't be permitted to breed (not that we were planning on it!) since the susceptibility tends to be hereditary, so we want to be absolutely sure there are no accidental litters (also the stress of pregnancy can, you guessed it, cause a relapse). Apparently Isis will always be a dog with "special needs" (see that there canine-first language, y'all? HEE!) and we'll have to keep an extra-close eye on her health for the rest of her life (I'll let you make your own jokes in your head here; very funny, Universe, oh haHA WELL-PLAYED indeed).   So, yeah. I didn't post yesterday because I was busy fretting and keeping the dog from walking into things, and I also kind of didn't want to share just how bad it was because I know *I* felt horrible for putting the dog through that awful treatment and didn't want any of the nice people who helped fund it to feel that way, too!    How are all of YOU?
title: I'll preface this by saying SHE'S FINE NOW

body:
...those of y'all who follow me on the Twitter or are Facebook friends of mine are already aware that MFA Puppy has had a skin thang going on that recently got a whole lot worse. We really didn't have the cash to take her to the vet until after the first but this morning I looked at the dog and she looked at me and I knew I had to get her some help or I wouldn't be able to live with myself.  
   So I took the dog and every cent we have to the vet and the news is not good. Isis has Demodectic Mange.  
   These ugly little fuckers are burrowing into her hair follicles and attacking her skin. Most dogs have at least a few of these mites on them, but because Isis was apparently infected at birth (her mother has some pretty ugly skin issues that the breeder assured us he'd had tested and were NOT mange-related; in other words he lied--the vet said he'd bet his house and his dog on that) and was recently pretty ill, her little immune system can't hack it and she's covered in infected lumpy scabs and losing her hair (she has the squamous type of infection and an early stage of the pustular kind--the vet showed me her skin scraping and pointed out the nasty little mites wriggling around on the slide, and then I dashed outside, doused myself in Purell and torched off my entire epidermis in the parking lot) (okay maybe I just fantasized about doing that; seriously my nerves may never fully recover from the sight, GAHHH BUGS!).
   Because pitbulls are particularly prone to Demodicosis, and Isis's case is a fairly severe one (her lymph nodes are enlarged and the skin scraping was pretty nasty, plus she has a secondary bacterial infection), the vet said that there are only two realistic and ethical options moving forward. One is very, very expensive (at least by MFA Standards) and the other...well, we're not ready to consider that. Apparently if we were to surrender her to the local SPCA they would automatically put her down, so that's not an option either.
   I swore I would never put up a donate button, because that's just troll-bait and personally I don't much care for donate buttons on blogs, and our problems (or in this case, our dog's problems) are not yours, but we've got ten days worth of ivermectin and antibiotics for the dog during which to decide whether to pursue aggressive treatment (involving weekly dips with Mitaban, which involve Isis spending a day at the vet for treatment and monitoring, and more skin scrapings to monitor progress) or...not...and Isis is a very young, very sweet dog who deserves a long and happy life. SO! You'll notice that there is now a "Donate" button down at the bottom of the right-hand sidebar. I didn't put it at the top because I didn't want it in people's faces when they come here; if you feel like contributing then we will gratefully accept the help (and the button will go away when we've raised enough for treatment one way or another or...well, we're going to be optimistic, so yes, when we've raised enough for treatment). If you can spare some cash and feel like donating, please specify in the "notes" whether you would prefer a refund or to have your donation passed along to the local SPCA in the event that we end up with more than we need for Isis's treatment.
   I'm sorry about this, y'all. Regular blogging will resume once we figure out what we're going to do about the dog. I'm pretty sad about this and not feeling the funny. Thanks.
  Figure One: This is my favorite picture of Isis (sleeping in MY SPOT, but I'll forgive her). It's a few weeks old but I don't want to post a picture of what she looks like currently. It is Not Dignified.
EDITED TO ADD********************************************************************************** 
Apparently the "donate" button isn't showing up for everybody. I am no techie, so if you want to contribute to the treatment fund (which now contains approximately 30% of the cost of treatment--THANK YOU!) and don't see the button, you can also PayPal funds directly to mfamamapay [at] gmail [dot] com
   Figure Two: Isis thanks you. I cropped this so as not to show the very worst because it is Not Pretty but you can see a few spots above her eye there--apparently puppies catch this foulness from their mothers through the close contact of nursing and it often attacks the face and forelegs first. Poor baby!
title: I really hate doing this, but...[EDITED]

body:
So because she's MFAmily, Isis hit a little bump in the road to recovery today...apparently the drugs are kind of hard on her stomach and she lost her breakfast this morning rather abruptly (no preliminary retching like dogs tend to do, just sat up and yarfed).   And I? Immediately completed my transformation into a crazy dog lady by calling to ask the vet if dogs could have Zofran (I mean, we have plenty on-hand between Hotter and Little Child's GI issues...the vet said no, let's not add any drugs and suggested a prescription food that should hopefully help her tummy deal with the harsh meds a little better), and whether we ought to bring her in (no, not unless she does it again tomorrow, in which case we'll have to change the antibiotic she's on), etc. I have no problem with pestering my kids' or Hotter's doctors, but I felt like kind of a dick bugging the vet. She was very kind about it, though, and Isis received a prompter callback and more sympathy than MFA people generally do from their doctors, hmm...
 Figure One: Y'all did this. Thank you so much.   On top of the GI issues, Isis seems to be having a rougher time with the mange itself...she's much itchier and losing more fur (which the vet who saw her for the mange predicted--he said it gets worse before it gets better as the mites start to die in the hair follicles).
  Figure Two: She's starting to get it on her snout.
  Figure Three: Her hind-end has lost a lot of hair and you can see the crusty mange-rash. Also that's a hunk of dead skin on her tail where she's got a patch too :(
  Figure Four: The other side looks a little worse; she's been gnawing and as you can see tufts of fur were festooning our bed this morning (I tossed the sheets in on the sanitary cycle and we've been changing them daily because I don't have the heart to kick her out of the bed while she's sick even if she IS messy).
 Figure Five: This is a close-up of what the demodectic mange rash looks like--if your dog has this GET THEM TO A VET!   On the positive side, though, the spot on her head where the mange first appeared and where she had one of the staph-filled pustules seems like it's already getting some hair back!

 Figure Six: See? There is new fur coming in on that lump! She has a tiny speck of mange on her top eyelid, the poor baby, but her face in general already looks a lot better!   Also on the positive side, we had set her first appointment for Mitaban dipping for the first of the month due to finances, but while I was picking up her prescription today I moved it up to tomorrow morning. I want to get started REALLY killing these fucking mites and am so, so grateful that we can do that!
title: in which Isis hits a little bump in the road

body:
I finally fell asleep last night, and when Hotter came to bed I wrapped myself around him and fell back to sleep, waking periodically to snuggle closer, and feeling very much that staying home had been The Right Thing To Do. It was a really nice night of sleep and comfort, and then we got up and took care of the poultry together, and nothing else had died in the night, so that was good. 
   It was feeling like the beginning of a really nice day right up until I ate breakfast, and the rest of the veneer popped off the stump of That Fucking Tooth.
   Now I have a lithp, and I know, both intellectually on my own and because Hotter has told me, that thith ith not the end of the world, but it sure does feel that way right now.
   I kind of never want to get out of bed again.
title: lithp

body:
I went back to work, and nothing fell on anyone, so I guess it was a good night.
   I wasn't fired either (I kind of doubted it).
   Rumor has it that the man The Steel Structure fell on is already out of the hospital and is going to be okay; someone who had his phone number started to tell the rest of us how many broken bones he ended up with and then Management heard us talking and told us to get back to work.
   I'm glad he's going to be okay.
   In safety meeting yesterday, Management apparently told everyone all of the ways that what had happened was the injured man's fault (he shouldn't have been helping to move the thing if he wasn't comfortable doing so, he was told to move as the thing fell and didn't, the equipment someone else was using to try and help move the thing was rated for outdoor use only and therefore none of us should have participated...) and I'm glad I wasn't there to hear that. I don't know if I could have kept my thoughts on that to myself.
   My tooth has continued to crumble by increments. Pro tip: if you have a tooth that's doing that, don't chew gum. Because when you bite down on a tiny little hunk of your own tooth you'll damn near throw up.
   I don't have anything witty to say today. I'm going to bed. 
   How are all of YOU?
title: I went back to work, and nothing fell on anyone

body:
*   Apparently Middle Child lost some in-game possession of Big Child's while borrowing a game for the DSi, and promised to get it back, which involves Middle Child having the same game, which he asked his father for, and which the XY is getting, because when he blows his nose twenty-dollar bills fall out or something. Apparently the XY called Hotter and said he was coming over with the late child support check and the all-important game. But Hotter forgot to tell me, so the front door was wide-open. The XY has a history of being a real home invader, thief, shit-stirrer and ne'er-do-well so I always make sure all doors are shut, locked, and bolted if he's coming over BUT I DIDN'T KNOW. BALLS! This gives me an adrenalin rush similar to when you find out your smallest child almost drowned at your ex-husband's girlfriend's mom's river house (oh yes, remember The 2011 Father's Day Massacre?), and I kind of want to smite every motherfucker in my life who pees standing up now, y'know?
*   My back is all effed up, like more so than usual, like as in "thanks to defective collagen I can usually place both palms on the floor and bend my arms at the elbow but today I can barely touch my knees." Also a toothache! Because life is dumb like that! Oh haha fuck you TOO universe!
*   Between all of the above, finances, and the fact that the MFA Minivan is still borked (I was going to take it in today, but given the ominous ache in the front of my face I'm going to hold off in case the dental situation claws its way to the top of the financial shitlist by Monday or something), I already had low expectations of the weekend anyway. So, you know, whatever. I have store-brand graham crackers, store-brand marshmallows, a six-pack of Hershey bars and I saved a dollar at checkout when I purchased them in that exact combination, which is pretty much an instant Jewgasm, and some of my favorite supermarket vintage, which was also on sale, and I'm about to crawl into the bathtub. I dare all of that to suck! YES, THAT'S RIGHT, I AM NOW OPENLY TAUNTING LIFE. I WILL BREAK A BOTTLE ON ITS' ARSE.
*   How are all of YOU?

body:
Have you seen the trailer for this movie yet? WELL WHY NOT? It looks like an excellent documentary and I hope we get a chance to see it here in MFAville.   I personally can't afford to donate right now because I'm trying to rescue my own personal pitbull over here, but if any of you who let me know you missed a chance to donate while I had the button up are still feeling generous, this is a really worthy cause (in a nutshell they're funding research on public opinion about pitbulls, raising money to cover the post-production costs of the documentary, and establishing a legal defense fund to help responsible pitbull owners trying to keep their dogs despite Breed Specific Legislation).
 Figure One: Y'all saved her life, and now it'd really make her smile if you helped save some less-fortunate pitbulls' lives, too.* Disclaimer: I am not affiliated in any way with Cover Y'all Productions or the documentary Behind The Myth. The MFAmily are fortunate enough not to live in an area affected by BSL, we're not in any danger of losing our dog as a result of such legislation in the foreseeable future, and we gain nothing if you contribute. I just wish I could, and since I can't I thought I'd help them out with a (very) little free publicity. Thanks!

Lately I've written a lot of posts that haven't seen the light of day, because they're about things I hesitate to share with y'all due to Stalky.
