*   Paul and I are now sworn enemies, as far as he is concerned. I can't say I blame him as having that thing on his head lanced couldn't have been much fun on his end, but it does make catching him for the daily reapplication of Neosporin a rather...stimulating...endeavor on my part. Ahem. Fortunately we haven't had any more terribly awful air quality days and I have the lungs to chase an irate rooster all over hell's half-acre back by the poultry enclosures.
*   The turkeys are truly foul fowl. Hotter reckons they're even nastier than ducks, which is saying something.
*   The ducks have grown up. Heavy D is DEFINITELY a drake and the three Flygirls are definitely girl-ducks. Two of the females flank Heavy D at all times and have become known here as "The Sister-Wives" and the third...well. She uh...thinks she's a chicken. She even roosts with the hens on their perches! Hotter and I feel pretty sorry for Lonely Duck, though, as she's Very Loud and we think all of her quacking has to do with wanting a mate. Someday when we're rich, we've agreed we'd like to get Lonely Duck a drake-friend, but we're also a little worried that we'd purchase a drake and he'd go right for one of the Sister-Wives (or Heavy D!).
*   Blind Boris is ailing and puny. At first we blamed the change of feed (from pellets to crumbles), figuring it didn't SOUND "food-y" but due to some balance, gait, and head-shaking we've come to the conclusion that something is neurologically wrong with the bird (and after all, she IS blind). She still seems to enjoy herself if you keep food and water handy, and prefers to lie in the shade near the rest of the flock, which she still trails by sound, so we're leaving her be. I'd cull her if she seemed to be suffering but if her needs are met she's content, and if Hotter doesn't mind caring for her (and he's a total bleeding heart about animals, and doesn't mind at all) she can do her thing as far as I'm concerned.
*   George de Ebil has been deposed as Head Bitch and has been rather subdued, so she got to keep her head too. Pardons all around!
title: various and poultry

body:
Total warm fuzzy from the tip jar, y'all. People threw in enough to cover the three dollars that was threatening to ruin July PLUS a quart of motor oil (which was vital because the MFA Minivan is hemorrhaging the stuff and will evidently continue to do so until I come up with the $400 for the further repairs...stupid gonna-make-me-be-toothless-even-longer piece of crap ARSEHOLE motherfucking minivan...), milk, bread, and cereal. Avoiding that overdraft means at least not starting the next pay period in the hole, and the quart of oil means it's safe for me to keep going to work. Also food is nice! Seriously though, my blog-readers bailed my arse out big-time and that is making me smile despite the not-so-much.
   The not-so-much being that...well, I can't say EXACTLY what is going on because it has to do with Hotter's People so I'll just say IN GENERAL TERMS that when Hotter and I got married and moved in together it was with the understanding that A Certain Party was Not Welcome Here, and he said that was fine, he understood, and then I made him repeat it back to me like, eleventy-million times to make sure we understood each other and he was all "OKAY, I GOT IT, JESUS." Fast-forward to yesterday, right after I hang up the phone with Weekend Warrior Job, having agreed to work the weekend of the 24th: "Oh guess what, X is coming to visit the weekend of the 24th and bringing A Certain Party with them--" and then after I spat his head back out again he said he'd fix it. This morning, I got home from work to "I know you're not thrilled with this but DON'T WORRY, I'm going to tell X that if A Certain Party isn't on their VERY BEST BEHAVIOR they WON'T BE WELCOMED BACK!" So I still have the Scary Eyes Of Killing Rage but he says he's going to make a phone call. WE'LL SEE.
   And how are all of YOU?
title: a warm fuzzy and a not-so-much

body:
Playing in flowers. No, really. That's what I did for a living today; messed about with expensive fancy plants in a botanical garden. For money. WHOO TITS!
   It's a good thing, too, because the elementary school principal hasn't seen fit to return my irate phone call of the day before yesterday.
   Which is fine, because I'm off tomorrow for a dental appointment anyway and would be DELIGHTED to pay her a visit, with or without said tooth in my damn head, I am still that mad. No, really--Hotter reported yesterday that Big Child insisted he gave him his amoxicillan wrong yesterday and I screeched WHAT?!? Apparently he used a tablespoon, and eyeballed 10 ml.* I promptly had a conniption.
   Light blogging probably through the weekend, as I'm working for twelve hours Saturday AT A RODEO. Seriously, it's like being on a reality show without cameras, my work-life lately, and I am enjoying the heck out of it.
* That said, the child is in good hands; as a diabetic of over twenty years and a chef Hotter can "eyeball" with the best of them. I just have a very strict "no eyeballing meds" policy, ESPECIALLY given the universe's Bad Fun Week with my childrens' health. Don't worry, I still made him swear never to "eyeball" liquid meds again and gave him The Crazy Eye for good measure.
title: know what's good for teh angry?

body:
*   I woke up around 3:30 a.m. having a coughing fit (I've had this cough off and on for Quite a While, but early this morning it saw fit to bring the gagging and the fever and the inspiratory and expiratory wheezes, the bitch thing) and browsed half-heartedly for a Royal Wedding broadcast. It was just getting started though, so I went back to bed where Hotter snuggled up to me and then said "is that your LUNGS? That's NASTY, baby!" Ugh. Also, I don't get all the Royal Wedding hate. Why NOT all get collectively excited about something frivolous for a change instead of outraged? This made me smile when I saw it at a more decent hour.
*   The school finally saw fit to return my call. I was on my way into the dentist's office at the time, though, and let it go to voicemail. My phone is currently charging and I am currently composing my thoughts. I don't want to lose the principal's attention by being all ad hominem; I'm more interested in talking about how to assure this NEVER happens again. The clinician should already have known, and therefore either needs to be reminded or educated on the importance of accurately reporting bleeding incidents in the two out of three MFA Children who have the bleeding issue. Also, I'd like an apology from SOMEone on the matter of anyone lying, PERIOD. I mean, again, I get that nobody wants to call Mama Pitbull and tell her the Preeeeecious got bopped in the nose, but if she either didn't know or didn't listen to how this happened because she was in a hurry to get the kid onto the bus she should have said she didn't know what happened. I'd rather get an honest "I dunno" than a dishonest ANYTHING.
*   My dentist re-glued the tooth, and didn't charge me anything. He also snapped an x-ray, which alarmed me, because he didn't do that last time and I thought maybe things looked worse, but he brought it into the room to show me and said "See that? That is IMPRESSIVE. I'm going to send this to your insurance company and they're going to be like 'OMG, Dr. Dentist, PLEASE help that poor girl!' and I'll be all 'don't worry, I am highly-skilled, and our client will be FINE!' and then they will THANK me!" I laughed and he said "either that or they'll tell us to piss up a rope and I'll do a crown for the lab and materials fees, but this isn't working." I asked how much THAT would be and he said $800 and I said "GET THE SUPERGLUE." He said let's just see what the insurance company says in a few weeks and go from there. I really do have an amazing dentist.
*   So anyway, I have a row of turnips to thin and a row of cucumbers to get into the ground, and the lawn needs mowing and there's dough rising for bread, plus I need to bake cupcakes and make buttercream and cook a celebratory dinner for someone's TENTH (!!!) birthday, as their father declined to see them on The Day Itself and I'll be working twelve hours. Fortunately, said someone is just as pleased to celebrate early as long as I make deep-dish pizza tonight. Young man, you have a deal! Also I suppose I'd better have a stern talk with my immune system, because this bullshit needs to be DONE WITH by tomorrow.
*   How are all of YOU?
ETA: You'll notice there's a new MFA Egg widget. Let's not make too big a deal of it this time. In fact, don't even LOOK at the damned thing. So far, so good though.
title: sunny Friday this and that [ETA]

body:
*   I was up at 6 a.m. as part of Lungapalooza '11 and its shitty little friend prednisone, and could NOT get back to sleep even though I didn't HAVE to get up for another hour and a half. I love my sleep. I NEED my sleep. I was in the ER and at the all-night pharmacy until 1 a.m. and was scheduled to work fo twelve hours forty-five minutes away today. Fuck. That. Action.
*   I left early for work, and it's a good thing, too, because I got pulled over AGAIN on the way in. Fortunately today's cop was a reasonable human being and saw that giving me a SECOND $60 ticket in twenty-four hours wasn't going to help me afford the effing registration fee, and let me off with an admonition to "get that taken care of as soon as possible." Also not five minutes before that, my effing tooth SHATTERED (as in, broke in NEW places and fell the fuck apart) and I think the missing front tooth made the officer feel sorry for me. I know it made ME feel sorry for me.
*   At work I missed most of the rodeo, which is a damned shame given that there were competitors as young as three (!!!) riding bucking SHEEP and roping baby goats. I would've liked to see that! But alas, word had gotten out that I a) wasn't breathing that well and b) knew how to cook so I got sent indoors out of the heat to help the chef. I made truffles and cookies and bread for a wedding. Which was fun, don't get me wrong, but dammit, BABY GOATS.
*   I got sent home two and a half hours early too, because it was slow and I think management was a little worried about my cough (I showed them the ER paperwork to prove that it was asthma-related and not anything contagious but it sounds...well, pretty fucking awful, actually, and I guess I can't blame them for being nervous). Such is life.
*   I have work at the botanical garden tomorrow, and am a little worried about how my lungs will handle all the pollen of tens of thousands of exotic flowers given that I was using the "use no more than every two hours" inhaler every two hours TO THE MINUTE all day, so Imma go to sleep.
*   I need $800 to fix my tooth, and $300 to get the MFA Minivan registered, and $500 for the ER bill, and about a week off until the prednisone bloat goes down and I can fit into my (or at least my husband's) pants more comfortably. Also, for my lungs to stop being assholes. Ideally all by tomorrow. It sure would be great if The Tooth Fairy came while I was asleep. Kinda doubt she will, though. 
*   Balls.
title: it was a long effing day but I made it

body:
*   I was doing really well at letting go of my fury; a visit to the Hippie Food Coop cheered me immensely, as did getting a new! fabulous! job! I was in such a good mood, I bought champagne and cookies on the way home and taught Big Child how to pop a bottle of bubbly (no, I did not let him taste it, although I did let him smell the cork). He was thrilled at the big boom, and said "I could HEAR it, it was so loud!" (yeah he's definitely got hearing loss on one side...which we're not discussing).
*   However then the elementary school (which I love in general; I love my kids' very highly-ranked school) fucked up monumentally in that they lied about how a child of mine with a bleeding disorder came to be bleeding on the schoolbus, stating that it was a spontaneous occurence even after I asked them if they were SURE. They said yes, yes they were. I said okay because I will have to give him medication...yes, they were sure. I met said child at the bus stop with a syringe of medication to help his blood clot in-hand and, in my hurry to deliver it as per hematologist's orders, already hooked up to a g-tube extension. I'm therefore REALLY glad said child is such a vocal little bugger, because apparently he got punched in the nose. YAY! I mean, shit, my kid got punched in the nose, but this kid hadn't had a spontaneous scary nosebleed in AGES and it would have represented quite a setback in my estimation of their overall health. But, problem with that? Is that if I had administered the clotting drug when the kid was NOT having a bleed from the blood-thing (bleeding after a punch in the nose is normal, bleeding as IF punched in the nose...not so much) it could have caused kidney damage and/or a stroke. Um...yeah. The principal and county health supervisor haven't returned my irate phone call as of yet, but my next step is the local news media. I mean hahaHA, thank you universe for the dose of perspective in that Big Child's hearing thing is most-likely temporary and very surmountable even if it's not but DAMN, WHAT THE FUCK, OH MY CHRIST YOU LYING ASSHOLES! The bleeding disorder is documented in exhausting detail on this child's care plan with the nurse and I get that you don't want to tell Mama Pitbull that her baby got socked in the nose but REALLY? After I asked twice and let you KNOW why I was asking? Oh hell no.
*   So I'm still walking around radiating ire, and the MFA Children are due home from their first visit with the XY since the decline of all civility, and there's like, a tornado going on. NATURE is pissed! It's cool though, because I'm all "BRING IT, BITCH!" 
*   How are all of YOU?
title: yesterday

body:
*   The vice-principal picked up when I called; the principal was unavailable (I am beginning to suspect that the principal is played by an animatronic robot; you get lots of recorded messages from her and she occasionally stands, does the pageant wave, and sits back down at assemblies, but I've never spoken to her. NEVER. Not once in four years of having first one, then two, then three children at this school, and not for lack of trying, either). The vice-principal was less apologetic than I would have preferred, harping on the whole "well maybe the clinician just didn't KNOW--" and I kept gently but firmly reminding her that if that was the case "the nosebleed was spontaneous" was not a true answer. She promised to look into it, though, and let me know if they need any "further documentation" of the bleeding issue. Hmph.
*   Big Child's birthday celebration went well; the pizza was well-received and the cupcakes, being Gwendomama's recipe, were of course phenomenal.
*   Unfortunately after dinner I went out to mow and must have run over a clump of ragweed (the only environmental allergy I have per testing) or something, because I had an asthma attack so fierce that a buttload of Benadryl, an emergency dose of steroids, and my inhaler did nothing to alleviate it. I stuck it out at home for about an hour but it only got worse, and finally I had to admit defeat and go to the ER. Which is NOT what our finances needed, but at least I felt vindicated in making the call when my pulse-ox upon arrival was 88 (this should be 98-100 in a healthy, non-smoking adult, and certainly no lower than 95--anything under the lower nineties is abysmal). Three hours, a chest x-ray (which was clean, which is good--I was starting to wonder if I wasn't getting pneumonia again what with last night's coughing/wheezing fit), a whopper-dose of IV steroids, several breathing treatments and a slug of codeine later I got back into the mid-nineties and managed to go several minutes at a time without coughing. That was good enough for them to send me home with prescriptions for a better inhaler, a taper-pack of prednisone (the dose they had to use to break the attack in the ER was so high that it wouldn't be safe to not do a taper, plus clearly something is blooming right now that irritates the HELL out of my lungs and therefore that's probably my best bet if I don't want to end up back in the ER sometime this week, DAMMIT) (those of you who know me might be shocked that I acquiesed to steroids at ALL given my history with the accursed things, but I refuse to take them "unless it's a matter of life and death," and breathing is rather important if you want to live, so, yeah), a bottle of codeine cough syrup, and instructions to take a daily antihistamine for the next little bit and DON'T MOW THE EFFING LAWN WITHOUT A MASK (in my defense I usually DO wear a mask, but the chickens got ahold of it today and ran all over the yard with the thing; I didn't want to put it on my face after they'd played soccer with it with their poop-feet).
*   Aaaaand I got pulled over on the way home for having an expired registration. Boo, hiss.
*   Yes, I am TOTALLY going to work tomorrow. I can't afford not to, especially now that I've got an ER bill to worry about. Damn and BLAST! Plus my job tomorrow involves spending the day at a rodeo, which is something I've never done, and when I'm not actually having an asthma attack I feel pretty much fine so there's no reason to stay home (plus I'll be on a robust enough dose of steroids for the next few days that the odds of another attack are pretty slim).
*   How are all of YOU?
title: today was not my day

body:
Today at work, the Big Boss asked me to lift more than I was comfortable lifting. And I said yes, because you don't say no to the Big Boss, and lifted the weight, and I must admit, in the name of honesty, of "journalistic integrity," or whatever you call it when someone is telling the truth in writing about their life, I lifted it, even though I felt sinews give, and muscles pull. 
   It hurt, and I felt sorry for myself.
   I felt sorry for myself, I am ashamed to say, until The Big Boss said to push The Steel Structure. The Steel Structure, I'd say (were I pressed to guess, because what do I know?), that weighed three times the weight of the heaviest horse I've ever owned, three times a Clydesdale, three tons, and we pushed The Steel Structure, I and my twenty-nine co-workers, we pushed it until it began to tip on one of its' two weight-bearing axises, and it began to fall.
   It began to fall, hurtling towards the ground, and we screamed "look out! It's falling!"
   And only one of us didn't hear, or didn't heed our call, and it landed on one of us, and he screamed.
   Oh god, I'll hear that scream in my dreams, no matter how many more nights I sleep.
   It fell on him, and we screamed, and we lifted it back up. But it was too late. The man it fell on, he screamed, and screamed, and all of us pushed, and some of us cried.
   He still went with the Big Boss, because the Big Boss said to come, and gave his testimony, out of our hearing.
   The rest of us put shelves on a rack without a top tie-rail, later, after The Big Boss told us to get the fuck out of there; it kept buckling and it fell at our feet because it had no top tie-rail, and we said to each other, "it has no top tie-rail, the shelves are the only thing holding it up!" and we piled them on anyway, the shelves, not counting notches in the pegboard, or shelves fallen, and picked back up, until the Big Boss said Go Home. And we went, the shelves lying on the floor, filing past our fallen co-worker, sitting on a chair, having reviewed security footage with The Big Boss, waiting for someone to take him to the hospital, who despite his injuries was sitting on a chair. We said things like "you okay?" and "feel better," filing past him, putting our hands on his shoulder to prove to ourselves that he was alive, "feel better, and sue 'em good!" some of us said, because it's what comes to mind anymore when something like this happens. "I hope you're okay," I said, "you should go to the ER," and he said, smiling faintly, out of it and shocky:
   "I will. They just want me to do some paperwork."
   And the person I am today patted him on the shoulder. "I hope you're okay," I said, with one foot out the door, because The Big Boss was looking. "If I were you I'd demand medical attention first, and do paperwork later," I said, the person I have become, "and I hope you're okay," I told him, and I went home and made love to my husband, because that is what the fortunate do.
   That is what I did, because The Steel Structure didn't fall on me. Not today.
title: a bad day at work

body:
*   Thanks to generous Twitter-friends, I'm back before the first of the month! WHOO TITS! I wasn't too happy about being "Blog Raptured," but the fact that I had a broken link in my last post that then stood for a week? GAH! It's like the OCD gods were trying to teach me a lesson...
*   You may or may not have noticed that my BlogHer badge has vanished. I had to think long and hard about it, but during the radio silence a letter came from the IRS letting us know that the student loan people had seized our entire income tax refund (which was roughly twice our average monthly income, for a sense of context) and that tipped the balance from "it'll be tight but sometimes one must do things for oneself" all the way into "fiscally irresponsible and selfish as hell." Between that and the fact that BlogHer '11 is being held right in Stalky's backyard, (and she'll be there--she's said as much on the Twitter to her friends, not just in her usual "I'll see you there and be passing out copies of my big creepy dossier All About You when I'm not busy crying bitter tears over our ruined friendship and carving our initials into my thigh with an Xacto knife!" e-mail)...meh. I'm not going to make my family eat ramen for the next two and a half months so that I can fly across the damn country and run into my stalker in a ladies' room.
*   Anyone wanna buy my tickets? I have one full conference pass and one parties/expo only ticket that I'm willing to sell together as a "lot" for $350. Shoot me an e-mail at mfamamablog @ gmail DOT com if you're interested.
*   My lungs, in case you were wondering, still suck. I can't even begin to afford a doctor's visit ($30) plus Levaquin, steroids, and more inhalers (~$100 if I'm lucky) until my next paycheck comes, and am not even entirely certain it would even help for more than the duration of treatment. I took last week and this week off from the various temp agencies, and have just been working Weekend Warrior Job in hopes that the rest would help me recover, but it hasn't, really.
*   The MFA Eggs (or, Hatch 4.0) seem to be doing fine. Or rather, nobody has unplugged the incubator, they've been dutifully turned, and all of them are in one piece. Who knows. I'm kind of jaded on the topic. We'll see. As for the other poultry...the ducks are starting to look like two male/female pairs although we won't know for sure for a few more months I think. The older chickens (what remain of them--we've eaten so many that egg production is just a trickle anymore) are in disgrace because they ate my cauliflower to the ground again and haven't been out to forage for a few days.  The pullets aren't laying yet but are almost there. The Consolation Chicks and turkey poults have gone outside the past two days in a small pen and loved it. I have a hilarious poultry-related vlog (yes, VLOG!) for y'all, but can't figure out how to get it from my semi-broken Blackberry to my craptop (the cable to connect them got et by a dog long ago, and there doesn't seem to be a way to upload the video without e-mail capability, which doesn't work on my phone anymore for some odd reason). I'll keep trying!
*   I'm getting rather depressed about our current level of poverty (I really ought to see a doctor about the lungs, for example, and I also still don't have a front tooth), but then CASE IN POINT over the next few days I'll probably be rather depressed in general as I can't afford to refill my Pristiq ($60) and am on half doses for the next few days, then quarter doses for two after that until the first. That ought to at least keep me from having a seizure (which is what happens if you just STOP taking the stuff...), but as I recall from the last time I had to taper off the stuff I still have a crushing headache and blackest depression with bonus anxiety dreams to look forward to.
*   Gee, aren't y'all glad I got unsilenced just in time for THAT?
*   How are you? I've gotten comments, I just couldn't approve them during the outage...but really, what are YOU up to? How's things? Did you lose weight you look extra-slende--OH! I won a slenderizing Lands End swimsuit in a Twitter party. I KNOW! I hate those Twitter parties TOO; I don't even know what made me participate but WHOO! FREE SWIMSUIT! So yeah, Twitter parties: perhaps not as godawful as I originally considered them to be. But back to you. GO!
title: and so I'm back

body:
So I interrupt my seratonin-deprived whinefest* to bring you an opportunity to help us out here that doesn't cost you anything IF you were already planning on using Groupon for something!
   From now until June 13th, I earn $30 in "Groupon Bucks" any time someone clicks this link and subscribes to Groupon (plus buys a Groupon--you have to actually buy a Groupon but I figured maybe one of you might be considering it anyway). We use Groupon here for things like veggies at The Hippie Food Coop and trips to the Science Museum (when we can afford it). They have a lot of good deals! They also like to torment me by running a deal on laser hair removal (shut up, I'm Ashkenazic, we're HAIRY PEOPLE) for VERY CHEAP but ONLY when I'm overdrawn. It's like they and Wells Fargo are in cahoots or something! Anyway, can't hurt to throw it out there, right?
 
*   Seriously, I just went to Little Child's kindergarten program, and the XY showed up late and did EXACTLY WHAT I KNEW HE WOULD DO which was to offer to take the kid out for a treat, and I WAS planning on using the last six bucks I have on a Red Robin gift card to take him out and split a dessert or something but it's kind of borderline whether I would still have enough gas to get to and from work and if we went over the gift certificate by so much as a penny I'd be screwed, but the unfairness of the whole "I can't afford to pay child support but I sure can be a big show-offy hero for PR purposes!" thing galled me and I CRIED. Like, seriously, in the middle of the hallway with children swarming all around me and my husband and my ex-husband standing RIGHT THERE lost my shit, and oh my god. If this is me on two days of a half-dose I can't wait to see what I do on a quarter-dose. SHOOT ME NOW. And then the XY offered to take us ALL out for ice cream ON HIM and my chin started quivering and Hotter pointed out that the other two children would be home soon (and offered privately to fake a seizure if necessary to get me out of it) and...yeah. Feh.
title: want to help us out? Do you use Groupon?

body:
Okay, so my day has sucked royally, as y'all know, and honestly I'd kind of like to go curl up in a ball and cry for no good reason (well okay, I have PLENTY of good reasons but none of them are acute/emergent, I'm just in a bad way), but I had to come on here and make a retraction of my earlier post about Wells Fargo.
   I was wrong about Wells Fargo sucking; they do not suck at all.
   See, I've been venting here and on the Twitter, and apparently Wells Fargo's Social Web Team actually pays attention to what people are saying and reached out to me on the Twitter. They DMed me an e-mail address, I poured out my tale of woe, and they responded with a phone number for their Executive Response team. I didn't feel like calling anybody because I hate the phone on a good day but figured I was probably the jerk in the situation if I didn't follow through and called, and...they were NICE! It turned out that my account is still with Wachovia (which is in the process of being absorbed by Wells Fargo) and the Wells Fargo people couldn't even pull it up, which honestly? I wouldn't have been surprised if they'd been all "NOT IT!" and told me to eff off, but instead the Wells Fargo rep got a Wachovia supervisor on the line and patched her in on three-way to see what could be done.
   And reader, they apologized and refunded the three most recent overdraft charges. A total of $105, which put us back in the black by enough that I was able to purchase a three-day supply of Pristiq and THAT? Is amazing. They absolutely saved my arse, and I take back every ugly and profane thing I have said about them today. THANK YOU, WELLS FARGO AND WACHOVIA, FOR NOT BEING SOULLESS CORPORATE GHOULS AND FOR MAKING ME CRY IN A GOOD WAY.
   NOW I am going to go curl up in a ball and cry. I went ahead and took the other half of today's Pristiq and hopefully I'm back to my normal, non-weepy self tomorrow because OMG TODAY HAS SUCKED. Everybody go and bank with Wells Fargo and Wachovia. The end.
title: RETRACTION: Wells Fargo is good people!

body:
Temp Agency #1 called me today about a new job. It's the overnight shift and involves heavy labor, neither of which exactly thrill me, but the main drawback (in my estimation) is that it's for a company I don't much care for (think soulless corporate megalith that's choking out a small business near you--I won't even SHOP there).
   I took the job anyway.
   This is perhaps the best indicator of how bad our finances have been recently; a month ago I don't think I would've even considered this job and I have turned a job down in the past on principle (it was for a pest-control company that's a major polluter and I would have felt icky about that, plus I was worried about the effect being around all of those chemicals might have on my lungs).
   I'm trying to tell myself that Soulless Corporate Megalith won't be signing my paychecks, and it's just for two weeks, but I am still not exactly delighted by the prospect of working there.
   Oh well. I start Monday.
   How are all of YOU?
title: the one where I bind and gag my conscience and take a new job

body:
I feel SO. MUCH. BETTER. This is totally not the way antidepressants are SUPPOSED to work; isn't it supposed to take weeks for them to build up in your system and, theoretically, to exit it? Maybe Pristiq is an exception to that rule, maybe (well okay, DEFINITELY) I have a freaky metabolism, who knows, but I swear I started feeling better after I took the second half of yesterday's pill and today I feel pretty much normal.
   Yesterday though? Yeah, THIS was me:
 Figure One: MFA Mama without Pristiq. Actually this is Zombie Chicken, formerly known as "Baldy" a.k.a. "The Bald Hen." The others have plucked her some, as you can see, and she's also Paul's favorite, which means her back gets a lot of wear and tear from his spurs. I have trimmed his spurs and filed the points off of everyone else's beaks (not to mention butchered the worst of the culprits), and she's actually looking a lot better than she DID. Still terrifying though. If the other hens are on the nest when I go to get eggs I just nudge them over no problem. Zombie Chicken though...yeah, she greets you with THIS face, and she pecks, too!
title: Zombie Chicken is my spirit animal

*   Yes, you read that right. Taint Rash is one of MFA Puppy's many nicknames, along with Blockhead, Catchphrase, Rhino Eyes, Keeller Peetbull, Fathead, and countless other terms of endearment that are (at best) in questionable taste. We don't use THAT one in front of the kids!   Hotter just brought the puppy out of her crate and plopped her onto the bed, where she came wagging up to me, thoroughly licked my face, and patiently allowed me to hold her and rock her and pat her and kiss her and call her pretty much everything BUT George.   I would have laughed a month ago had you told me I would turn into one of THOSE dog people, but honestly? I'm going to miss the hell out of this stupid face while I'm in New York City:
  Figure One: Yes, it's dark, but it's the best shot I could get. Most of them came out MUCH worse.
  Figure Two: See? When I make kissy attention-getting sounds she cocks her head back and forth FAST!
  Figure Three: Or else raises her head up just as I'm clicking, partially decapitating herself.   "What about your CHILDREN," Hotter asked me this morning, teasingly. I said they'd be with the XY for visitation whether I was here at Casa MFA or at the New York Hilton. "What about your HUSBAND," he wanted to know. "We did the distance thing for a long time," I reminded him. "My heart is accustomed to that, just like it is with the kids when they go to their father. I'm not USED to missing the dog! Plus she changes so fast--I'll come home and she'll be HUGE!" He laughed. "She'll probably be like STEP OFF, BITCH, THIS IS MY SIDE OF THE BED NOW! She'll be MY dog and forget ALL ABOUT YOU!" He stopped teasing me then, because he could tell I was really sad about this. "You won't miss her anymore once you're drunk," he said consolingly. "Are you kidding? You've seen me drunk--I'm MAUDLIN! I'm going to be the only person at BlogHer who's three sheets to the wind and sobbing about missing my Taint Rash!"   He pointed out that probably I'll be the only person on EARTH crying about missing their Taint Rash.   So if my roommates are reading this, could you maybe chew on my braid while I sleep?   Thanks.
title: "Oh Taint Rash,* I think I'll miss you most of all!"

MFA Puppy is the first dog I have owned in a very long time, and some of the products available for dogs and their owners nowadays seem a little strange to me. Take Greenies. They're these little green things that look like an attachment for an anal sex toy and smell like jerky that are supposed to make your dog's breath stink less:
  Figure One: They also stain your sheets if you let the dog eat them in bed. Oops.   Greenies are just the tip of the "are you kidding me?" iceberg though. BEHOLD!
 Figure Two: "The anticoprophagic condiment for dog rations!"   Oh yes. Apparently you sprinkle this on your pet's food and it "imparts a forbidding taste to excrement."    You know, in case "tastes like shit" isn't enough of a turn-off by itself?   I have some questions about this. For one, you're talking about something that already (quite literally) tastes like shit, and this...makes it taste worse? Worse than shit? If that's the case, how do you get Fido to eat it in the first place? I suppose it's possible that the product is enteric coated, or reacts with doggy stomach acid somehow, so we'll move on to my second and more pressing question.   How the hell did they test this stuff?   Did they advertise at dog parks offering fair compensation for people to bring their shit-eating dogs into the lab as part of a fecal focus group? Was there a control turd and a Forbid-den turd? Were the dogs blindfolded? Hang on though...you can't ask a bunch of dogs if they are extremely unlikely, somewhat unlikely, neither likely nor unlikely, somewhat likely, or extremely likely to polish of the turd they're just taste-tested...OH MY GOD, HOW MUCH DID THEY OFFER PEOPLE TO COME AND TELL THEM HOW MUCH MORE LIKE SHIT THE SHIT WITH FORBID IN IT TASTED?    Surely the cost would be prohibitive when you're developing a product that retails for $1.25 a packet.   I call bullshit shenanigans; this has got to be a joke.

body:
Today Weekend Warrior Job SUCKED! The venue was told to expect 6,000 people for this concert, and instead it was more like 150 who showed up, and the beer truck I was managing (heh, yeah, I had three people working under me today, which was kind of hilarious) only made something like $150 in sales, which when you figure that the two beer truck guys made $40/hr apiece just to be there (they didn't like, pour or hang out around the truck or anything, just set it up, went and took naps, and drove it away afterward), times seven hours, plus my time and the three temps I was managing (who made slightly less per hour than I did but whose time cost the venue about one and half times per hour what they were paying me)...yeah, Weekend Warrior Employer took one in the pooper today. Which meant that management wasn't happy AT ALL and also that they slashed everyone's hours for the REST of the weekend, so rather than a thirty-six hour weekend for me at this job it became a seven-and-a-quarter-hour weekend. OUCH! Also ouch? We were supposed to have a tent but management decided it might block the beer truck sign and hurt sales, so my forehead (oddly JUST my forehead) is really effing sunburnt. Crap.
   I was also annoyed because Temp Agency #1 wanted me to start work at Soulless Corporate Megalith tomorrow night or Monday night, and I told them I'd start Monday night since I was supposed to be at Weekend Warrior Job tomorrow (and Monday during the day), and wanted to see if I could still start Sunday, but Temp Agency #1 doesn't have anyone in the office on weekends. I decided to take some freaking initiative though and called the Soulless Corporate Megalith store directly and they said yes, come in tomorrow night, PLEASE, and Temp Agency #1 and I will settle up for that on Monday I guess (they're cool so I trust them to make it good). So that's good, but all in all I'm not particularly happy, since I specifically TOLD Weekend Warrior Job I couldn't afford to come out there for less than eight hours (it costs me $20 in gas round trip just to get there), and today was supposed to be twelve but ended up being seven and a quarter. Also I am usually one of two employees running a concession stand or one of a herd of banquet servers, and instead I had to manage the beer truck, which meant that I was responsible for inventory and the till and telling the temps what to do. Plus my forehead really hurts and I have a family history of skin cancer. Etc.
   On the bright side, a very kind reader mailed me a gift certificate to a specialty store that sells fancy meats, and it arrived today. I was probably going to have to butcher another chicken before the first of the month if not for this, so it makes me extra-happy as we're down to only five laying hens at this point (plus butchering chickens is Not My Favorite Thing). How are all of YOU?

Someone brought it to my attention this morning that Stalky is still talking smack about me and agitating others to do the same, despite the fact that recent events in her life really OUGHT to keep her busy thinking of other things.
   This doesn't bother me in and of itself, as the things she is saying are so blatantly untrue as to be laughable and nobody who's worth a damn will listen to her anyway (several friends have told me over the past few years that she's made overtures toward them and proceeded to "warn" them about me; they've mostly ignored her). What does bother me, though, is that she's even thinking of me anymore at all. Because we're talking about someone I was friends with for less than a year OVER THREE YEARS AGO. We haven't had any contact AT ALL in nearly TWO years (well, I haven't had any contact with her; she's done her creepy stalky commenting/making gmail accounts based on my name and e-mailing manifestos thing a few times). I only think of her when she actively stalks me, or when someone goes "hey she's talking shit about you on Twitter again!" or, sadly, when I decide how to describe something new to do with my life or work on here (I always have to consider whether she could potentially use new information to worry or annoy me). But apparently she thinks of me quite a bit, unprovoked, has made friends with other creepers on the innernet solely for the purpose of continuing to discuss and harass me, and just. isn't. letting. go. and that? Bothers me. It's creepy, and I'm actually starting to feel kind of sorry for her, because the way she reaches out to me around holidays and major life events of HERS makes me think she's not all that invested in her own life and family, and that's sad. What she's doing, this unhealthy dwelling and obsession (to say nothing of the stalking and cyberbullying), is probably indicative of a real sickness. I feel even sorrier for the real victims of all of this, the children Stalky is responsible for; I grew up with severe mental illness in the household and it's not an easy thing to live with as a kid (or hell, ever). As an adult who is unrelated to Stalky and lives on the other side of the country from her, I have (and have exercised) the option to cut ties with her, change jobs and homes and phone numbers to make it harder for her to screw with my life, and surround myself with the love and support of people who are immune to Stalky's charms and dirty tricks. Her kids can't do that. That sucks for them.
   S., if you're reading this (and I know you are), please just stop. Stop reading my blog, stop stalking my Twitter feed (I blocked you, so maybe the next time you're signing out of your account in order to view mine you could take a moment and evaluate honestly whether what you are doing is a healthy and beneficial thing), stop your incessant researching of my life both online and off. What happened between us was unfortunate and I'm sure we both have our regrets, but I've moved on and so should you. Don't do it for my sake, do it for your own and that of your kids. For everyone's sake I wish you peace; you have a lot of good things going on in your life and we'd probably all be happier for it if you'd focus on those instead of me.
title: oh, Stalky

body:
*   I spent quite a lot of time in the garden today. It needs so much weeding, it's ridiculous. The corn and okra, and about half of the tomatoes are stunty, as in "not going to amount to much, I don't think." They're perfectly welcome to prove me wrong. So far the beans and the other half of the tomatoes and the zucchini bushes and the straighneck yellow squashes are our best performers (aside from the lettuce, which has been great, and the cucumbers, which haven't produced much as of yet but are very much On Their Way). My herb garden is fabulous! And this year I think we'll get some good moonflowers, which is always exciting (they're the only flower I much screw with that you can't eat or make tea out of).
*   The turkeys are suddenly getting rather huge. I had to trim their wings some more (although one of them bled, ack!) because they were eyeing the gaps at the ends of the roof of their enclosure (we keep them under a tarp-roof so they can't drown in heavy rain, which they absolutely would have a few days ago during some crazy storms) and they're not very easy to hold and contain. Hotter is getting rather averse to it, actually, so I may be on my own next wing-trimming time...in his defense they do beat the hell out of you with their wings and the cut feathers are kinda sharp and pokey. The older pullets are starting to look like they're ready to lay, and could theoretically do that any time now (probably it'll be another few weeks). The very moment one of them does we're slaughtering George, who is so evil anymore that even Boris the Blind shies away from her (perhaps she emits a palpable menace? Hotter thinks Boris is working on a crude sort of sonar...) and everyone is missing a feather or two from her savagery.
*   Tonight we had a "firefly party" after I made a feed store run (and gave this URL out to some nice ladies there who were thinking of getting some chickens--HELLO!). We had a festive dinner and then the boys stayed up late and I busted out some glowsticks I actually got from Weekend Warrior job ages and ages ago and had been saving and had a "firefly party" signaling with the glowsticks and catching lightning bugs (no, not in jars--we released them so they could return to their families, much to Hotter's disgust). Whoo!

body:
*   Canning. Oh man! I've been canning all day (when I wasn't building a fence around the winter garden or cleaning out the game room).
*   I made some apple-cranberry butter, and went to blend it in the Cuisinart, and Hotter said what he usually says about how you shouldn't blend boiling mixtures and I said what I always said about how I'd never hurt myself doing it and hit the switch, and then the top of my Cuisinart blew up and sprayed boiling apple-cranberry butter all over my left forearm, lower lip, chest, and shoulder.
*   Really bad burns don't hurt at first. I stripped my shirt off and ran cold water over my arm (which had been holding the top of the Cuisinart in place with a bar-towel and got the worst of it), and when it started to blister before my eyes and I got dizzy I squirted some cold aloe from the fridge on it, threw some gauze over that, and slid a piece of Surgilast over everything, calling to Hotter that I thought we ought to go to Patient First because I'd just burned the crap out of myself. Hotter, being a chef, is not fazed by burns and reminded me that they'd just dress it pretty much the way I had and give me drugs. "I...want...drugs..." I said, sitting topless with blisters rising all sexy-like. "I'm just...getting...my shit...together." I think I may have gone into a mild state of shock as I got dressed. Hotter was dubious about my ability to drive, but we made it to Patient First okay.
*   The nurse doing triage looked at my arm and sucked air through her teeth appreciatively, then walked me straight back to a treatment room and poured a bunch of cold saline over my arm. That felt great. A doctor came back and peeked, and winced, and took my blood pressure and shook his head, and said it was definitely second-degree and that I must be in a lot of pain judging from my blood pressure (it was 130/90, haha, oops). He told me to take my wedding ring off in case my fingers blistered, too, keep antibiotic ointment on the area when the blisters burst, watch for signs of infection, take two Vicodin every four to six hours for the next couple of days, and refrain from blending boiling mixtures. Hotter snickered. I refrained from telling either of them to eat a bag of dicks and gathered my blisters and my wounded dignity and we went back home. So THAT wasn't awesome.
*   What is awesome is the cranberry sauce I made today and canned so it'll have plenty of time to jel by Thanksgiving. It's so pretty, and smelled so festive! Also today was a four-egg day and I processed a large pumpkin and have pie filling in the crockpot making the house smell marvelous, too.
*   I'd been wrestling with what to call the cranberry apple-butter, but after all of that? Crapplebutter it was.
*   Don't blend boiling mixtures, y'all.
*   The Mennonite butcher I called about venison went hunting for us today and got a buck. He's turning it into four "summer sausages" (they're like giant hard salamis), vaccuum-sealed tenderloins, and packets of ground meat for chili and spaghetti sauce. Doesn't get much more organic and local than that! It's illegal to sell venison here so he's giving us the deer and we're paying him the $80 to process it the way we want it. I like knowing that the meat was handled properly from field to fridge, and have been very impressed with this company's work in the past on grass-fed beef I've bought from a local farmer and venison I've had in the past. My going entirely vegan isn't practical since Hotter isn't down with meatless dinners, but I'm done with factory-farmed meats and this plus the milk and meat CSA seems like a good compromise.
*   OMG THE DOG! I am so proud of her--my next-door neighbor (the older lady to the left, not the asshole with all the mangy pitbulls to the right) had her nephew and his kids over, and they wanted to see the dog and she was GOOD and LISTENED and did all of her tricks for them and they were very impressed and thanked me profusely for bringing her over. Personally I KNOW I have the cutest, smartest, most wonderful dog on Earth, but it's nice to hear that confirmed by others. GOOD DOG, ISIS! I have some adorable pictures of her in her Halloween kerchief, but it is time for more Vicodin so perhaps I'll load those later. How are all of YOU?
title: canning and a trip to Patient First

body:
So this is my bank account this morning:
 Figure One: Poverty is expensive. 
   As you can see, I don't make a lot of money, Wells Fargo is made of FAIL, and June is already going to suck here at Casa MFA. Wells Fargo, I HATE YOU. It's not your fault I'm a broke-ass deadbeat, but do you seriously HAVE to mess around with the dates of purchases so as to charge me even MORE money I don't have in overdraft fees? And...what the hell do I have overdraft protection from my savings account (and its' entire three dollars of life savings) for if you're going to say "haha, you overdrafted, here is your fee!" and THEN throw the three bucks down the negative-balance K-hole? That's just mean, it's like you're rubbing salt in my wounds. I'm not going to sit here and say I didn't deserve at least one overdraft fee, because I knew that that would probably happen when I bought food at Sam's Club but, well, my children want to eat three times a day and my ex already calls CPS on me every time he gets a stick up his arse, so feeding them is kind of non-negotiable. I was prepared to suck it up and start the month of June in the red in order to keep food on the table. I was NOT prepared for you to eff with the dates of purchases like this, which will add at least two MORE overdraft fees, which if you look at the amount of my paycheck that I deposited on the 23rd means that half my next week's income will go to JUST covering bank fees. And while we're on the subject of how you suck, Wells Fargo, how about we discuss that $44 transfer to savings that you do EVERY MONTH and that I've NEVER ASKED YOU TO DO and TRIED SEVERAL TIMES TO CANCEL? This entire clusterfuck is a prime example of BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE IN ACTION. I may not be able to afford to switch banks now, and I may be resigned to taking your crap lying down, but someday if I'm ever in a position to take my business elsewhere you can bet I'll do just that.
   So yeah, Wells Fargo has pretty much guaranteed that I won't be able to climb out of this bottomless pit any time soon, and now you see why I decided that BlogHer this year would be sheer idiocy.
   BUT! It totally won't fix my life or my tooth or my lungs or even, sadly, my mood for the day thanks to Wells Fargo, BUT! Typepad/Say Media? IS AWESOME. I woke up to this in my in-box this morning:
Hi-I noticed your tweets about TypePad gift certificates, and I wanted toreach out by opening this help ticket in your account.Offering an option for TypePad subscriptions to be available as giftsis something the support would like to see made available, and we'vebeen conversing with the rest of the TypePad product team to providethis feature. Right now, we can do some magic with billing behind thescenes to make it happen.Do you need a couple months free to continue your own TypePadsubscription or want to give another TypePad blogger some free time?Either way we're happy to help!We understand if this month your subscription to TypePad is not a highpriority in your budget but you want to continue to maintain your blog.Or if you want to help someone else out who needs a to take a couplemonths off.We're happy to supply you a discount code to give to a friend or applycredit to your own account. Just let us know how we can help! (Let usknow the address for the other blogger you want to help out ifapplicable.)-Jen
   Jen, I heart you. I didn't ask Typepad/Say Media for a danged thing, but they just happened to be present on Twitter when I was bemoaning my blogless-due-to-finances state and a friend was saying she wished they offered gift certificates so that she could sponsor my blog, and they decided to reach out and help. THAT IS AMAZING. THAT IS WHY I HAVE BEEN A MEMBER SINCE 2005. Wells Fargo, TAKE NOTES!
   Now I'm going to go back to coughing up a lung (yeah, I guess I won't be going to the doctor next pay period, either--THANKS A LOT, WELLS FARGO) and being bitter over the fact that my ex is a cocknozzle (yesterday he proceeded to treat my six-year-old like his therapist and tell him how he's SO CONFLICTED because he'd LIKE to take his weekend visitation but mean old Mommy and the judge won't let him have the boys cohabit with him and his girlfriend and Daddy hates his own house because it's MESSY and NOT AS NICE AS CATHERINE'S so he didn't know what to do! Because yeah, he COULD take his visitation but that would mean Daddy being very sad over his messy house and missing his girlfriend!) who can afford to buy extravagant gifts that he won't let my kids bring home, and tells them they can play with them at CATHERINE'S house when mean old Mommy lets them come back there to visit. And all the while he's stiffing me on child support because he's terribly poor. But he bought my kid a pair of light-up Darth Vader Stride Rites last night that cost more than I spent on groceries last week (see above) and if I comment on that then I'M the asshole. Let's all take a moment and weep for the XY, shall we? That poor guy! It's terribly hard when people expect you to spend every other weekend away from your sugarmama's nice big clean house! Almost as hard as it would be if you only got to SEE your significant other every other weekend for over a year due to that same "no overnights" clause in the court order! Oh wait, that was ME! Haha, my bad.

body:

*   Bonnie, another super-cool reader and commenter, e-mailed me and wanted to know if I'd be introducing any new scents/varieties of MFOrganics Sea Salt Scrub and mentioned that she'd especially like some rose-scented scrub. I told her it was a funny thing, actually, that I was planning on doing rose but trying to find some affordable and certified organic food-grade rose water, then in the time I took just after sending the e-mail to source some excellent stuff Bonnie e-mailed me back suggesting the very type of Bulgarian Rose extract I ended up going with. I decided to stick with the Isis theme and call the original formula of MFOrganics Sea Salt Scrub "Lucky Dog," and in honor of Bonnie, I'm naming the soon-to-be-released coconut-rose variety "RedDogRose" (she'll recognize the reference I'm sure).
*   I was talking to a friend-inside-the-computer who's having a rough couple of months in a "been there done that" place that I do not look back on fondly at all, and twisted her arm to let me send her an organic mini-Thanksgiving in a Basket. If it comes together as nicely as I think it will (I'm picturing some pumpkin pie-filling, cranberry dressing, baking mix for bread, possibly candied yams...?), would y'all be interested in a raffle of sorts to win a duplicate basket? I'll show you pictures when I get that done.
*   I've had a few people write to ask how Isis is, and she's doing great! We still see her favor her leg once in a while when she takes a bad hop or something, but no more so since tapering down on the steroids (she's down to 5mg of Prednisone twice a day after first 20mg then 10mg for five days each), which is a good sign. We've started adding some glucosamine/chondroitin/antioxidant joint supplement granules that smell like someting a dog would love to her food, and she's back on normal rations (no more prescription food). I'm also trying some home remedies suggested by the vet as well as ones I grew up using on animals; my position is that if I know it won't hurt, and the dog is willing to eat it in her food, and it seems to help, I'll do it in addition to what the vet prescribes. So she gets a clove of garlic minced into her breakfast and dinner, and four Brewer's Yeast tablets mixed into each meal to hopefully make her less palatable to the mites as well. She's very shiny (I use the "Lucky Dog" on her--so I guess I can't say that it wasn't tested on animals, but I tested it on myself first so there's that, and then towel-dry her and comb her with the Furminator).
*   Meredith's mama sent me some dog kerchiefs that she made for Isis, and is providing some for the winner of my fundraiser/giveaway. Photo shoot to come after tomorrow's grooming!
*   If you'd like to enter the contest, it doesn't close until the second, which gives everyone a chance to cash their checks. Haha! I know how I am and figured some of y'all were in similar boats, so there's still time to get in on the organic gift and goody-basket...

body:

Whoo, tits!

Current treatment plan: ignore it except for taping it before exertion because them's the shakes with my connective tissue disease and I'm not interested in acquiring narcotics or orthopedic interventions including non-covered durable medical equipment, period, end of story. Boo, though, it bears saying three times: boo. To add insulting further (minor) injury to (moderate) injury, the athletic tape I used today caused a strip of my shin-skin about as wide as, oh, athletic tape? In admiring the label before opening it to make a grilled-cheese sandwich on local artisan bread I saw this, took a moment to say "oh dear, this is a bit crunchier than I'd planned on going for my family," then said eff it I want that sammich and OMG, the sammich was a motherfucking transcendent experience. body:
*   Middle Child is much better, although he's still mostly just lying there with a blank look on his face. He's alert enough to open his eyes when the doctors poke at him, which he wasn't for a while there, and when I left the hospital this morning the XY was feeding him pancakes.
*   The official verdict is "probably some kind of GI virus or else maybe food poisoning, but either way someone else in the house would be sick" (my current respiratory crud doesn't count because it's not GI-related in the least and Middly isn't coughing). So they really don't know. His whitecount is a LITTLE bit elevated, but not much. His sodium level is out of the seizure zone into the "merely pretty damned sick" zone (and Middly did NOT actually seize at any point, which I very much appreciated), so that's good. His kidney labs weren't awful so they're chalking up the non-peeing to dehydration and watching and waiting on that. He does NOT appear to be diabetic (Hotter heard "acidotic" and went off on a diabetes-tangent, because when he was a wee acidotic lad that was why but it turns out babies and small children get acidotic if they're just really dehydrated).
*   Because it can't ever be easy, though, the admitting physician at Hospital B discovered a new and fairly noisy heart murmur in his exam. He didn't say anything until after a litre of fluid was in because apparently there are sometimes murmurs in otherwise-healthy kids who are just really dehydrated. Nobody thinks this is related to the current illness that CAUSED the hospitalization or anything, but because Middly has my connective tissue disease and the cardiologist who did echos on all three of my kids when they were diagnosed determined that Middly had a "pulmonary flow murmur" but nothing else cardiac wrong with him (and really, if your kid has a murmur you want it to be a pulmonary flow one because they're so harmless the other term for them is "innocent murmurs" and kids just outgrow them), and our pediatrician hasn't heard that in two years, they're not thinking that's what this is. Nobody wanted to guess or anything, beyond "NOT a pulmonary flow murmur, this is louder and more to the right," but they said that if Middly holds his breakfast and lunch down and starts peeing he can probably leave the germ-infested pediatric ward by tonight and have the echo as an outpatient (if he stays they'll scan him tonight). So I'm guessing this is nothing to panic over, but hearing that one of my children has a cardiac abnormality is Not My Favorite Thing.
*   CATHERINE! called me. She seems very nice. More on that later.
title: Middle Child update with bonus phone call from CATHERINE!

title: oh no

body:
I felt like I owed y'all an update, but I'm tired and not feeling very witty at all. Middly is at CATHERINE's house with the XY and reportedly doing better, although I think I kind of preferred it when he was in the hospital and I could go and check on him if I wanted to. As to why Middly is at CATHERINE's...I was forced to back down from my "you take them over there and leave them with her instead of taking them home with you ONE MORE TIME and I will--" stance because honestly? The XY's house could be on Hoarders. It's truly scary. And while CATHERINE is clearly...y'know, I can't even call her an idiot because the same thing happened to me; the XY is very charming until he's not...so we'll just say artificially ignorant of what she is dealing with here, after speaking to her I can say with 100% confidence that she will take excellent care of my son in her huge, huge house with her scads of money and her clean, hygeinic beds and refrigerator full of healthy food, and that's really all I care about right now if I can't have him home, although this is absolutely THE LAST TIME (and the XY has backed down and actually verbalized understanding that this is THE LAST TIME because [insert legalese here]).
   That said, while I am glad that the XY and I are finally on the same page with regards to his leaving the children with CATHERINE at her house (largely without him present) every time he has them, I think it may really harm his relationship with CATHERINE and destabilize him in general, which is never a good thing. Because I will not share details of how I know this, but after speaking with her I can say with absolute certainty that she's dating him because of the kids. She is an excellent mother without any children who was essentially pleading with me to be okay with the XY delegating my children to her because she loves them so for most of the lengthy conversation. She kept telling me about how she has SUCH A BIG HOUSE and THEY ALL HAVE THEIR OWN ROOMS and she GOT THIS HOUSE TO RAISE CHILDREN IN (she was ladylike enough to leave out the GOD DAMMIT but I'll say it for her because what has happened to her regarding children prior to the XY is unquestionably Not Fair)...I don't know how well it'll go over when he puts his foot down on this with HER. And no, before anyone asks, I'm not insisting we all follow the "no overnights" clause because HE insisted on it and I'm bitter that my kids got a stepfather they'd barely met because of it (although I am bitter about that). I'm insisting on it because this clearly Will Not Last and they're already attached to CATHERINE and they have lost enough; when she and the XY inevitably split it'll really hurt them and I don't want them to feel homeless on the XY's weekends to boot when that happens, plus they have all mentioned that CATHERINE is awesome but they'd kind of rather spend the weekends with their father.
   This whole thing is breaking my brain. CATHERINE seems like a genuinely nice person who has had life hand her a lot of shitty things (and I mean a LOT; girlfriend could give me a run for my money in the Pain Olympics) and I can absolutely see how life has set her up for a sociopath like the XY to swoop in and take advantage, and it's breaking my brain. Because if I told her to run screaming I wouldn't meet the next girlfriend, and the next girlfriend probably wouldn't be Mary Freaking Poppins, and I'd be right back to where I was before I spoke to her. If I didn't have children I would go down to the courthouse, get a transcript of my divorce hearing, and give it to her, and she would be spared a lot of pain. But the fact is, I am a mother, and I am not her mother, so...yeah. She's on her own.
   Which makes the fact that the XY has apparently told her nothing but GOOD things about me and she wants Hotter and me to come over and let her cook us dinner REALLY fucking awkward. I told her I thought that might be a bit much and that I didn't want to make anyone uncomfortable. She rushed to assure me that she's fine, MORE than fine with it, because I should get to see the environment my children spend so much time in and then we can be FRIENDS!
   Now what? I can't exactly say anything approaching the truth (that we're not that amicable, not even close) without tipping the XY's hand, but I also can't be a bitch to CATHERINE and blow her off because I just spent FOUR MONTHS raising hell with the XY over his refusal to let me meet her, plus it would be like kicking a puppy. But if we just bite the bullet and go it will be the most uncomfortable meal EVER because the XY and I are nowhere NEAR that amicable, Hotter is pleasant to the XY but understandably Not A Fan, CATHERINE seems rather intimidated by my looks (for whatever reason, I don't get the impression she's ugly or anything and I assure you that I am not All That) and insecure in her relationship with the XY, who remains fundamentally unable to NOT look at my tits if I'm in the room (as evidenced ONCE AGAIN by our time at Hospitals A and B) and all in all if we do this I think any survivors of the evening will end up on the evening news...Plus okay, FINE, I'm worried that if I gave her any reason to suspect I'm anything less than perfect she'd jump the shark, marry my ex-husband, and put her fortune to use suing me TO DEATH for the children because SHE wants them. I don't get the sense that she's the kind of person who'd do such a thing, but I'm frequently wrong about people and the XY would totally be on-board with that plan (if he hasn't already suggested it) and I? AM NOT PERFECT.
   Halp?

body:
Now that I've got work, and am slowly but surely getting our finances caught up (yes, we're still flat-fucking-broke, but that's AFTER I was able to afford Hotter's transplant meds rather than him having to ask family for help with those, so baby steps, right?), I've noticed something...
   I'm all gimped up again. DAMN it!
   See, while I know it's some kind of tributary to that infamous river in Egypt, I had thought my general health to be much-improved. And it is compared to when I was living with the XY, but I've once more got a persistent cough with occasional wheezing, and a stress fracture in one leg and arthritic morning agony in the opposite ankle, and my calf muscles are back to being persnickety crampy whores, and my back aches, and...yeah. I know, intellectually, that connective tissue diseases don't go away, but I'd somehow convinced myself that I was no longer as damnably delicate as I once was, and apparently I still am, it just wasn't a problem as I wasn't working outside the home. Sure, I was able to dig in my garden and mow and do housework and go for hikes in the park, but looking back I was also able to take frequent breaks during those activities, and stop for the day if something began to complain. Not so much when I'm working in a giant kitchen or scurrying around a banquet hall.
   It's not the type of work that's problematic, really, either. When I used to work at a desk I'd routinely have episodes of bursitis in my hips from the sitting, repetitive-motion injuries galore, computer-user's hunch-related issues in my neck and upper back...the fact is, any time I ask my body to perform work on any kind of clock (where I can't change positions or lie down for a bit whenever I need to, or quit for the day when something starts aching) I'm going to suffer, and while nothing is currently in the "unbearable, MUST get some medical attention" place, it's probably only a matter of time.
   This worries me. Not only because I dislike pain as much as the next person, but also because I love being a temp, and as a temp I don't have short-term or long-term disability coverage the way I would if I had the same job every day. And while the obvious answer to that would be to get a regular full-time job, that's not practical given that in this house, someone occasionally needs the hospital and I'd just end up losing my job over that, or else I'd have an injury that would mean restrictions on what I could reasonably be asked to do once a doctor weighed in and THAT would end in my losing my job. As a temp, if I'm ill or injured I can decline to accept work until I've healed up without penalty. But then, what do I do if something REALLY major happens? What if I'm in a car accident and I break a bone? What if I get a pinched nerve that lasts for months and months? THEN what? I still don't think going on permanent disability is an option for me, although my specific connective tissue disease has been added to the list of officially qualifying conditions, because I'm not crippled by it on a daily basis at this point, only SOMEtimes. Plus with the household caps in place and Hotter already being on disability, I don't think we'd get enough between the two of us to pay the bills even if I DID qualify. Plus going on permanent disability requires that you document your ailments with trips to the doctor, tests, etc. that I really can't afford anyway. 
   I'm trying to take things day by day, and today the most important bills are covered and I'm sore but could still work if I got a call to come in tomorrow, so I'm going to try not to dwell on hypothetical situations that are beyond my control. But...what if?
title: the one where I worry about the future

That last post was a downer, so here's something that's not--BABIES!

title: bacon makes EVERYTHING better (at least while you're eating it)

body:
I had put together a neat little goal list back when it was all good and I was chortling happily over my sixty-nine hour week, but didn't publish it because I figured that was just tempting the universe (where the fuck did THAT come from? I am not superstitious!) and held off, and now it's DEFINITELY not in the cards any time soon (thanks a lot, Botanical Garden, you pretty little fool*) but maybe I was wrong, maybe putting it out there will motivate me to work harder (and get on board with the temp agency where my twice-former co-worker/friend's company goes for their overflow staffing needs, so I DO have something in the works, plus possible additional Weekend Warrior Job hours) and turn it into a self-fulfilling prophecy?
   Hi, I'm MFA Mama, and I just said THAT. But seriously, as some of my older co-workers have taught me, being optimistic is free. So here's a prioritized list of what I NEED to make happen, or else seriously re-evaluate going to BlogHer and possibly sell our tickets (sigh):
*   Pay co-worker who saved my arse yesterday back the gas money I borrowed.
*   Purchase "deer fencing" (something LIKE that--not that very one probably as it was just the first Google shoved at me when I was looking for an example to show y'all--I can probably find a much better deal, possibly through e-Bates with site-to-store delivery) to keep the garden safe from deer and chickens, so our plants don't get eaten. I've butchered most of the roamers at this point (poultry ones, not deer) but the younger ones are starting to come up there so clearly it's just What They Do. Plus we actually have deer. The kids love them, and I'm fine with them grazing in the yard, but NOT from my garden. Probably I'll have to spend at least $100 on that though (we have our own poles from the clearing we're doing at the back of the property).
*   Have the MFA Minivan serviced (only $21.99 at MFA Mechanics, including oil, filter change, and tire rotation) and get it a new headlight (about $60 plus installation, although usually MFA Mechanic cuts me a break). Then update its registration (about $150 all told due to my needing to pay the property tax on the thing to register it).
*   Get the Dyson and the lawnmower fixed. Probably going to be about $300 (?) all together, I'm GUESSING. The mower needs a lot of work including a new blade if they won't sharpen our chipped and dented one.
*   Fix the fucking tooth. I dislike that almost as much as a day of toothlessness, because I'm mostly immune to dental anesthetic. My dentist and I have agreed that the lingering soreness I get from him attempting blocks is not worth the very minimal benefit and that he'll crank the nitrous all the way up and just try to be quick while I go to my happy place. "And if you cry, I'll cry, so raise your hand if you need a break," he always reminds me. I never have, it's just like ripping off a bandage--better to have over and done with. But never another extraction. If I need another of THOSE I'll have to find money for the general. Bah. Fortunately I've done root canals like that before and they're not TOO bad. Which is to say, they still suck about as much as you'd expect, but I've had worse. Even with my dentist cutting me every possible break, that's $800. Ouch.
*   I need to have a vision exam and glaucoma check, as it's been a few years since I saw an eye-doctor for non-emergent/non-surgical eye things, and get new lenses from my glasses (which have valiantly soldiered on since 2006). I already have some new frames I bought on e-Bay one time for a song while I was rich, so it's just the exam and the lenses, which'll still probably be about $250 since they'll have to dilate my eyes to check for lens issues (THANKS, CONNECTIVE TISSUE DISEASE!).
   Okay. Tomorrow I'm signing on with two more temp agencies and probably working on the car thing, as it's been over 3,000 miles and I'm driving it a lot more lately. Grr. WARFACE!
 
 
 
*   Name that reference and you earn my eternal fondness.
