body: Last night my ankle was killing me. I distracted myself with The Time Traveler's Wife.    Yeah, I was one of like, three literate people who hadn't read the book and it goes without saying I haven't seen the movie. Or maybe it doesn't. I don't yawp about it or anything, I'm not an evangelical boycotter of television and film but we don't have or want a t.v. and don't go to movies. We have before, I mean like, once, and once in a great while we'll watch something on DVD but a) I prefer the meaty printed word to the fluffy, non-nourishing cotton candy for the eyeballs that is most commercial news media and sponsored Hollywood films anymore and b) aside from the quality of such endeavors being driven down the long slide by sensationalism and aims toward corporate sponsorship and syndication, advertisements geared toward the general public make me foam at the mouth a LOT so it's just better that I occupy my time in other ways.   It'd gotten to the point where even though everybody and their dog said I needed to read The Time Traveler's Wife, to the point that I bought it when there was an attractive book sale going online, the combination of genuine busyness and oppositional "if everyone likes it so much it's going to be crap, CRAP I SAY" snobbery kept me from reading the bloody thing until finally a night where I was in enough pain that I knew I wouldn't be productive came along and I was badly in need of a mental escape and WOW.   This is the first time in AGES that I have read a work of fiction and not only been engaged and immersed in the work, but also been able to pick it apart at the seams and study the pattern, the craft, the work of it in a way that left me even more in awe than at first glance, AGES, by which I mean a decade or so.    It was as close to a religious experience as I get, y'all. And then a combination of FB-stalking a biological relative, ranting about same to Hotter, and a conversation with a new friend who suddenly seems a bit more like a muse made a cast of characters and interwoven plot lines come crashing down around me like cats and dogs in the proverbial rain storm. Ideas were landing on their feet unscathed and jumping at me with muddy paws, or yelping in agony as they hit the ground, a cacaphony of joyful, heart-rending inspiration, and I found myself playing fetch in the yard with the dog, because dogs give you a good beard if you really just want to talk to yourself out loud for a bit, muttering like an idiot until I had to come inside and sketch out a motherfucking outline.   This is going to be so much work. I'm so excited.   Now let us speak of it no more except possibly in vaguest terms. I know, I suck, but I'm not going to workshop this via blog. I may not even mention it again anytime in the next several years or possibly ever, but I thought those of you so inclined would prefer to be happy for me in the abstract and those of you who wish me no good might like to suck it because I am so damn happy it's revolting. Cheers!
title: rainmaker

body:
* Remember that ear infection I just got over? Yeah. Not so much, actually. Two weeks off antibiotics and one wretched summer cold courtesy of The XY via Big Child and it's back. Yesterday it would have been silly to go to the doctor because it was Just A Cold. Today? Kill. Me. Now. Earache. Sinus. Fuck.* I got a taste of today's pain and said fuck this action I am going to Patient First because this cannot ride out the holiday weekend. Please someone remind me how I love them next time I'm on the fence about medical treatment on a Friday. In and out in forty minutes with three prescriptions (antibiotic, antifungal for afterward, and Vicodin) and a referral to an adult ENT surgeon because "it's got so much fluid that it might still burst in there, and it's not even THAT infected yet." Which? Boo. But still, pretty much exactly what I expected to hear and I was pleasantly surprised that the doctor referred to my previous chart with them, saw that I had checked "coagulopathy" in medical history, and said "you want a script for pain? I see that you should stay away from NSAIDs but that ear looks excruciatingly painful?" Also every single doctor at this particular Patient First is distinguished-looking, and reassuringly personable, like someone whose chest you could weep upon, and if I'm honest with you I love that shit when I'm this miserably ill. All for the same co-pay amount as seeing my PCP.* Also that doctor gave me the best advice EVER: he said to go and present my driver's license to get some real pseudoephedrine, get an actual neti pot (I generally just cheap out and use 60-cc syringe barrels and gravity), use it, and then use nasal decongestant in ONE nostril (and alternate them) and OH MY STINKING FUCK Y'ALL the relief, the sweet, sweet relief. It was like an enema for my sinuses and now I can actually BREATHE and I can tell that BOTH ears are now exquisitely painful but thanks to the Vicodin I don't so much CARE and hopefully by tomorrow the antibiotics will have taken effect.* This ear really has jumped the shark. What gives, Lefty? You've been fucked up since I started this blog, turning every virus into an ENT debacle, often involving multiple rounds of antibiotics. In fact, I think this is your eighth course of them in twelve months. Unacceptable!* So now money sucks again because two weeks of Levaquin plus paying toward my deductible for, I am guessing, a myringotomy on at least the left side sometime in the next few weeks equals FML, POVERTY but we've already paid the vet for the dog and we'll manage. It's always something, right? Wow, I am on a LOT of drugs. Haaaaaa...hegh.* At least the day before this virus felled me we took MFA Puppy out to have some real fun. In downtown MFAville there is an island in a river with a walking bridge one may cross with leashed pets to enjoy a large park full of wooded trails, boat ramps and natural and manmade steps to the water for swimming or kayaking, and a lot of historical ruins to explore. I know half of y'all only come here for the puppy, so here ya go... This is MFA Puppy on the bridge:
    The only bad thing about the outing was that it was in the mid-nineties and MFA Puppy got very, very hot despite our bringing a covered dish to give her drinks out of and was starting to drag along and whine like she wanted to be carried. That would have been hard to do, as she's hit a MAJOR growth spurt since going into treatment for the mange (I think it was stressing her whole system, or maybe the infection was, but either way suddenly she's in MUCH better general health and spirits), so we walked out onto some flat rocks intending to sit down and let her rest. We had to carry her across a deep crevice over some little rapids and figured we'd let her off-leash on the large, flat rock at the other side as several other dog owners there had done with their four-legged friends. We figured she'd be scared of the river, but our panting pup promptly flopped down in the shallow water's edge to get some relief from the heat:
     After she'd cooled off a bit, MFA Puppy noticed that there were dogs chasing a stick as a pack, and stood up to watch them intently:
    This nice man, who was wading and playing with his dogs, called to MFA Puppy and encouraged her to come out into the water, and she'd pretty much crawl through broken glass to greet a new person with licks and total-body wags so she very gingerly waded out further and then back in (you can see one of her new doggie friends keeping an eye on her with his owner):
     Once she saw that there were hundreds of tiny minnows darting around her ankles, MFA Puppy got braver and explored the shallows with her new pals (they also did quite a bit of leaping from rock to rock chasing each other and deeper-water swimming, but I was too busy keeping an eye on MFA Puppy and exclaiming over her daredevil plunges and feats of agility with Hotter to take pictures of that):
     When MFA Puppy started getting a little too brave for our comfort (she tried to follow some labradors out into the strong current) Hotter and I clipped the leash back on, and finished our walk with her much happier for having cooled off a bit. She got a second wind afterward that lasted until we got into the MFA Minivan, where she used the hiking backpack, which we'd stashed between our seats, as a pillow and napped all the way home:
     As you can see, the antibiotics, Ivermectin, and various nutritional supplements we're giving MFA Puppy on top of her high-quality meat-based kibble to help her skin and coat recover and bolster her immune system (Brewer's Yeast and Garlic tabs, Omega-3 rich salmon oil, and Pettabs Plus) are working well and unless I get the "bad" side of her profile (or any shot at all of the base of her neck and top of her back) in excellent light like this you can't even see anything wrong with her (and the hairless spots are way better-looking than the swollen abscesses and pustules were!):
     Here's a shot of her "good" side, that also shows you the super-cool color her eyes are right now. We're rather hoping they'll stay like this (what a pretty girl!):

body: Parenting causes you to utter a lot of odd-sounding things in the heat of the moment. For example, I went on a rampage yesterday while the MFA Children were at dinner visitation with their father.   See, Hotter and I had sent off for Bend it Like Beckham from Netflix (he'd never seen it, and we both have a thing for Parminder Nagra, so...), and planned to watch it on the flatscreen in the family room, but when we went in there there was nowhere to sit. The entire wonderful leather couch was covered with DVDs, video games, Mr. Potato Head parts, army men, dirty socks, missing permission slips, matchbox cars, and Harry Potter books.   This makes me lose my junk and get the crazy eye. Not only because if this crap punctures my couch I will foam at the mouth, but also because as many times as Hotter and I clean that damned room up, confiscate all games and DVDs and make the children earn them back one by one, make chore charts and award gold stars, and mutter about infanticide, this still keeps happening and DOES NO ONE LISTEN WHEN I TALK???   So this time rather than cleaning it up for them, I just swept all of the junk onto the floor, where it formed a noble heap. One by one the MFA Children discovered their possessions on the floor upon returning home and lost their junk. Why were their treasured possessions on the FLOOR? Had I been careful not to break x? What about y? WHERE WAS Z??? I explained that if they were going to show so little regard for my couch I was done showing so much regard for their crap.   All three children gasped and stared at me, jaws agape. See, I don't curse in front of the children (ever) unless it's Festivus, and I count everything from fart on up to fuck as a curse-word, including crap. So that really got their attention. "THAT'S RIGHT," I ranted, "THERE IS A NEW RULE IN THIS HOUSE! NO CRAP-HEAPS ON THE LEATHER COUCH! NO CRAP-HEAPS, PERIOD. PEOPLE ARE GOING TO START PUTTING THEIR CRAP AWAY OR NEXT TIME IT IS GOING IN THE TRASH. I AM GOING TO MAKE A SIGN WITH A DRAWING OF YOUR CRAP AND A RED CIRCLE AROUND IT WITH A LINE THROUGH IT. DO YOU UNDERSTAND???" Four heads nodded (because when I get the Crazy Eye like that Hotter toes the line, too), and Big Child had the presence of mind to stammer "y-yes, ma'am!"   That sterling example of my parenting skills occurred yesterday, and today the MFA Children came home from school and (this is my conjecture; I wasn't actually watching this as I was lying down with a bag of frozen corn on my ankle*) decanted their backpacks onto the couch in the living room (which is not leather but microfiber, but is less than a year old and also emphatically NOT where crap belongs), then garnished it with their hoodies and some random household items, so that when I hobbled out there was nowhere to sit.   "EVERYONE GET YOUR CRAP OFF THE COUCH OR IT IS GOING IN THE TRASH! THIS IS YOUR LAST WARNING. FROM NOW ON I DON'T CARE WHAT IT IS, IF IT'S ON A COUCH IN THIS HOUSE IT GOES IN THE TRASH!"   "You can't frow dose papers away, dose are for school!" Middle Child protested.   "OH YES I CAN! IF IT'S ON THE COUCH, IT GOES IN THE TRASH, EVEN PAPERS, BECAUSE IF IT WAS THAT IMPORTANT IT WOULDN'T BE LYING ON THE COUCH LIKE A PIECE OF CRAP!"   Big Child, who has a death wish promising future in litigation or philosophy or something else having to do with ethics or lack thereof, said "oh really? What if it was the original draft of the Declaration of Independence?"    "IF THE FOUNDING FATHERS CAME TO THIS HOUSE AND LEFT IT ON THAT COUCH, THAT WOULD GO IN THE TRASH, TOO!" I roared. Hotter did his part (which at times like this is to stand beside me with his arms crossed and nod agreement when the children look to him as if he ought to step in and have me committed, either because he agrees wholeheartedly or because he's just glad it's not him getting the Crazy Eye) and added "and the consequent lawlessness would be the fault of people not respecting the couch, not your mother!"*   If you follow me on the Twitter you're already aware that I sprained my ankle this morning. It still hurts a lot, and did very little to improve my opinion of my childrens' merit as housemates here at Casa MFA.
title: and the consequent lawlessness would be the fault of people not respecting the couch, not your mother

body:
I'm going to do that thing I do where I talk about pleasant things that aren't necessarily at the very forefront of my mind, but are nicer for me to think about and y'all to hear about than the things that are.
   MFA Puppy continues to do very well, considering what she's been through. She's off the steroids now (after tapering down carefully--I weaned her in smaller increments than the vet had even suggested because I KNOW how awful steroid-withdrawal is for the mind and body) (although to be clear, I ran my plan by the vet first and he was okay with it--I would never just go off half-cocked with prescription medications, even with the dog) and we have to take her for a follow-up skin scraping this coming week. I won't lie, I'm pretty scared that it'll show she's relapsed again (between the stress of her recent immune/autoimmune crisis and the immune-suppression from the steroids). Not only is that not something we're financially prepared for at the moment (thank y'all SO much for your donations--I used them to cover some of the household expenses I had postponed paying/neglected to pay, such as the power bill, in order to get Isis the veterinary treatment she needed emergently; I hope that's okay with everyone who chipped in), but it would also suck in that I'm sure all of these heavy-duty drugs and treatments aren't the best thing for a growing puppy. Like the rest of us here at Casa MFA, Isis could use a break, and it would be so great if she could just be a normal dog without one or more daily prescription medications for a while!
   Getting around to the title of the post, for those of you who aren't aware B.A.R.F. is an acronym that stands for "biologically-appropriate raw foods." It's a diet some of the more "extreme" dog people (and some cat people, too, apparently) choose for their pets where you try to provide the types of foods they would ingest "in the wild." On one hand, it's supposed to be a lot easier for animals' bodies to digest and healthier for their teeth. On the other hand, it's expensive, messy, and kind of a pain in the arse (plus domestic dogs are man-made creatures who haven't lived "in the wild" for maaaany generations). We've heard from many people (including some of y'all) that it's the best thing for dogs with allergies and other health problems, and a lot of pitbull owners really swear by it for helping to prevent a lot of the skin and joint problems the breed (particularly "bluenose pitbulls" like Isis) is prone to.
   When we bought a whole deer, we couldn't help but notice, though, that the price of the processed meat (per pound) wasn't that much more than the very high-end dogfood we feed Isis at her vet's recommendation, which got me thinking...the fruit and vegetable components of a typical B.A.R.F. diet can come (at least in part) from what you'd normally throw out in cooking (things like smaller broccoli stalks, eyes of potatoes, soft berries and discolored apple bits), and the meat you feed (including skin, organs, and raw bones from chicken, etc.) is often stuff you'd discard as well (the venison is great but you actually need to provide some bones and fattier meats as part of the diet ideally--we'll probably use a lot of venison but also include other things when they're on sale or going to waste otherwisea). In our house, the fruit and vegetable waste goes to the chickens, but I generally have more than they'll eat since I do a lot of canning and baking, plus eggs (and even egg shells) are included in the B.A.R.F. diet as well (and we have plenty of THOSE--today was our first five-egg day!). So when you look at it that way, the cost of feeding OUR dog the B.A.R.F. diet is about equal with the cost of what we've been feeding her already (maybe a little cheaper, even, given that we grow our own veggies and have eggs from our chickens), and since Hotter is a chef who can't work due to his disabilities and I work from home and don't mind getting my hands dirty it's no real hardship on us to prepare special meals for our dog. If we didn't have chickens, and cook everything from scratch, and have access to affordable venison and plenty of time to kill plus the skills we have, I would NEVER consider feeding Isis the B.A.R.F. diet (and please don't think I'm being all superior and judgy if you don't use it for your pets!), but, well...she's already pretty high maintenance and if it can help her be healthier then Hotter and I decided it's worth a try (we're also going to see if our Mennonite butcher friend might be willing to sell us some deer livers, kidneys, hearts etc. on the cheap). We'll still keep the Blue Buffalo on-hand for convenience if we're really busy and for when we're traveling, but other than that we'll do B.A.R.F. meals for Isis.
   Isis had her first B.A.R.F. meal today for lunch. Here's what she ate:
   half a pound of raw ground venison    about four ounces of chopped apple I pared off the cores from the organic apples I am making into applesauce today   two large organic raspberries   two raw egg yolks from the MFA Flock   one ground eggshell (for calcium)   a tablespoon of flaxseed meal   a tablespoon of plain, organic yogurt from the hippie food coop   two minced cloves of garlic   a teaspoon of Brewer's Yeast
   I was expecting it to be a lot grosser (totally a word), but honestly after I'd mixed everything up Hotter and I looked into the bowl and agreed that it didn't look half-bad. Isis (who'd been watching me mix the food up and already gotten excited when she saw the meat go into her dish) wolfed it down with evident relish and polished her bowl.
   So yeah, my dog eats B.A.R.F. Heh!
title: B.A.R.F. (an Isis update)

body:
*   I'm sick again (still?) with some kind of "cough until you gag" virus, I think. No fever or other symptoms (I'm a little achy in the coughing muscles but it's not like a flu-ish bodyache) but I'm exceedingly annoyed because I don't like to spend this much of my time coughing and my expiratory wheeze/"squawking") is keeping me up at night (sweartogawd last night it randomly sounded, at various times, like a ship creaking, someone shouting for help outside, a kazoo, and a newborn crying). I think Hotter thought I was hallucinating or something when I kept tossing and mumbling, then I made him put his ear against my chest and now I think he just thinks my chest is haunted.
*   Tomorrow it's back to the grind, and while there is SOME excitement involved (I'm changing the formula by which I create copy for my main freelance client to reflect changes in way the industry has started to deliver its main product to end-users, which dear god I just read that back over and could I BE any more vague and boring? Still, it's exciting), overall I'm not ready for the holiday break to be over with. I get to usher in a new level of involvement in social media on behalf of the client and that's kind of...well. Anyway, it's SOMEthing. And by something I mean "something I'm pretty stoked about overall but would rather not have to do just yet, DAMN IT, because I had planned to return to work HEALTHY and RARING TO GO."
*   I think Jessica hit the reason I was so flabbergasted about the bagel thing neatly on the head in her comment.  Hotter is TOTALLY your typical, average guy in a lot of ways, including  not knowing that there's a boiling step involved in baking bagels. This  screws with my head because I expect better of him--he's my soulmate! A  chef! He knows the female anatomy better than I do! He's not allowed to  not know things like how you have to BOIL effing bagels. But then, if  not knowing about boiling bagels helps him retain the knowledge of how  to do that thing with his thumb...
*   This coming Tuesday is Hotter's and my first anniversary. Which: already? Really? It both feels like we've always been together and seems like it can't possibly have been a year yet. Aww.
*   Poe remains at large, and likely we won't know what became of him one way or another until Spring (when we either discover him alive or smell something), if at all. This does make laundry, searching under beds, and "name that sound in the night" more stimulating for the entire family but I'd rather we located the fucker.
*   I have been having a lot more success in being at peace with the XY since I started using Irretrievably Broken's mantra. She should seriously write a book because changing that one thing (thinking of the XY as an au pair rather than the children's other parent) has saved me SO many conniptions since I read her post...). The au pair is late to take the children to dinner again, but he also works fulltime and Hotter and I do SO enjoy our date nights...the au pair was humping his girlfriend on the couch and a child walked in, but well, what do you expect...I wouldn't hire this au pair again if I had it all to do over again, but for as long as he's been with my children and as little as I pay him (nothing), well...you get the picture. If you have an ex-spouse whose inability to remember what age of child needs a carseat and who's allergic to what antibiotic makes you killy, I wholeheartedly suggest that you try this.
*   No-bake cookies. y'all! I keep ranting on the Twitter and y'all keep asking me for a recipe, but...well, here's how I cook. I started with this and halved it, because damn that's a lot of no-bake cookies (also I skip the boiling part). Then I used dark chocolate peanut butter instead of regular, halved the sugar, omitted the milk, and used a teeeensy extra bit of peanut butter (plus approximately 1.5 times the rolled oats called for). So um, no recipe, really, I guess, just go into your kitchen and start throwing things into a bowl like a maniac. I made more of these last night but cut the sugar by a further half and used vanilla sugar, and subbed  sweetened coconut flakes for half the oats and they were delicious.
*   Ugh. Work. Should go now and do some--how about you?

body:
*   Little Child is no longer on the lam from the county truancy officer (okay, nobody seemed to care that he wasn't in school except for the XY's hypothetical attorney, who I think is technically a figment of his imagination anymore, but my way sounds less anticlimactic than a well-visit with the pediatrician), and went to school immediately after his physical (and shots--dude needed to finish up some he wasn't healthy enough to get every dose of in a more timely fashion and of course he got his flu shot). OH NOES I HOPE TEH SHOTS DON'T GIB DE BABY AUTISM!
*   No, the XY's hypothetical imaginary attorney wasn't rushing to Little Child's defense against the school's clearly discriminatory actions toward the poor kid, they were (allegedly) getting ready to have me declared unfit because WHY WOULD THE SCHOOL EVER LIE, YOU ARE JUST NEGLIGENT OR ELSE HONESTLY MISTAKEN BUT HOPELESSLY STUPID. Oh yes. THIS is why acrimonious relations with an ex-spouse are kryptonite to super co-parenting; of course the school isn't going to cop to rounding up the gimps and sending them all home en masse, and even though the relevant (common to both parties) child was ONE of those gimps someone decides to get nasty and side WITH the school because the school sides AGAINST the other ex-spouse and screw the kid's education and feelings. THIS is why you need to grow the hell up in a hurry if you are a parent going through a divorce (assuming you didn't at the appropriate point upon becoming a parent already), people of the innernet. Because if you don't your kid loses, no matter how hard their other parent tries to fight for them. Of course, if you're the type to let school district beaurocracy trample all over the civil rights and fragile self-esteem of a five-year-old with special needs just to be a petty cocknozzle, you probably don't care. BUT I DO.
*   Good things, good things...OHYES! Guess. WHAT! Little Child is ON THE GROWTH CHARTS FOR HEIGHT AND WEIGHT FOR THE FIRST TIME SINCE BIRTH!!! YEAH BABY!!! Today we savored the heady bouquet of the FIFTH PERCENTILE, PEOPLE! And he's in the fifteenth for weight, and HE'S NOT EVEN A LITTLE BIT ANEMIC, HIS H&H WERE TEXTBOOK PICTURE-PERFECT! I...I am all verklempt, y'all, I mean I knew he was doing really well but I didn't realize he'd turned the tide like this, because see, there's something I haven't really been sharing with you because we've been holding our breath about it but Little Child passed dairy and soy challenges with flying colors and has had NO food restrictions since his visit with the GI specialist late this past summer. That was a sign that while he may not (for whatever reason) be able to consume or adequately process a normal diet, perhaps the allergy component of whatever was inflaming his gut had resolved. BUT HE HAS STARTED GROWING ALL BY HIMSELF WITHOUT GROWTH HORMONE SUPPLEMENTATION OR ANY OTHER EXTRAORDINARY EXTERNAL VARIABLES AND HE'S NOT ANEMIC AND OH MAN OH MAN MAYBE HE REALLY WILL STILL OUTGROW WHAT AILS HIM COMPLETELY AND BE OKAY!!! I am not entirely sure I'll believe it just yet but for the first time EVER all signs seem to point toward rather than away from that possible outcome, and for that alone even if it changes I'll always be grateful. I'm so thrilled, and neurotic, and thrilled...there just aren't any words for it. Our pediatrician and I just stood together and exclaimed over how fabulous Little Child was for a solid five minutes saying nothing but "I mean...LOOK AT HIM!" and "I KNOW!!!" "This is..." "MAYBE! I MEAN WHY NOT! I MEAN...WELL, LOOK AT HIM!" Then we both pretended we had something in our eye.
*   I have more to say, but I don't have the heart to follow that up with a boo because really, the bad will work itself out or at least be over at some point. Heh. I'll catch y'all tomorrow.
title: alternating the yays and boos

body:
Let me just preface this by saying that Hotter and I are both bisexual.  I'm still not sure that gives us the street cred to be making these kind of jokes, in fact I'm not terribly comfortable with it.  Hotter is totally the instigator here, and how I feel about a man who will suck another man's [redacted] talking smack about "the gays" is a whole separate post because REALLY?  But anyway this is all tongue in...cheek...we <3 teh gays here, and if financial difficulties don't force me to sell my ticket you'll see me at the Queerosphere Party at BlogHer motorboating as many people as possible.  Also none of the conversations that follow took place within earshot of children, because I don't even let my boys say "fart" and have avoided telling any of them that sex exists, although they know that "gay" refers to a man who loves and wants to marry other men or a woman who loves and wants to marry other women (they just think marriage is about having help raising whatever children you have via parthenogenesis or adoption and not being cold in the bed at night, and will continue to think that for as long as I can keep the myth alive) and that you never, ever, EVER use that word in a pejorative context.  So.  If this post offends you, I apologize.  It offends me a little bit too but it also makes me giggle so I thought I'd share.   It started with Underdog.  He's not a terribly friendly snake; he isn't aggressive or anything, and I doubt he can even open his mouth wide enough to bite anybody, he's just terrified of pretty much everything.  You would be too if you were the size of a #2 pencil and had "non-functioning eyes."  I'm just saying, I don't blame him for being afraid but there is one thing he apparently likes: diamonds.  See?

  Figure One: Yeah, I anonymized the ring.  It's gorgeous, though.  Very flashy.   This led Hotter to some speculation about Underdog's sexuality (which incidentally we have no idea what sex either of the snakes are, they're just kind of male by default because, well, snakes).  Then we got Poe, and then we got Poe Balzac, and the only logical explanation (per Hotter) for a nearly four-foot rat snake allowing a mouse to teabag him repeatedly is that Poe is a little light in the loafers (actually he prefers Mary Janes; when Poe escaped from his feeding cage I found him wrapped around a pair of high-heeled Mary Janes in the front closet, which did absolutely nothing toward ending Hotter's assertions as to Poe's homosexuality).   Now we've got the chickens, and innernet research leads me to believe that one of them might be a cock.  Which would be bad news because you can't have a cock in the suburbs.  I mean, I don't think there're any regulations since we're zoned agricultural here but the neighbors would come after us with pitchforks and torches, and anyway we paid for six FEMALE chickens and we want laying hens.  We do not want a cock (although this entire chicken-sex debacle will have been worthwhile if even ONE MFA Child goes to school and tells their teacher that Mommy has discovered through looking at pictures online that she has a cock and is very upset about the whole thing).     "It's not a cock," Hotter said, after squinting obligingly at the chick in question's leg color and head-spot size.  "Blondie's just maybe a little bit butch is all.*"  Then today our coop arrived via FedEx Ground and Hotter said something about painting a rainbow on the side.  "Why," I asked, "the chickens aren't--oh wait, it is kind of a wee little prison, isn't it?"  "EXACTLY," said Hotter, "a wee little women's prison.  That burly-assed spider you killed last night was probably the last hetero in existence at our house.  Way to go."   Except the problem with that is that if the chickens are gay they might all die.  Because pardon my bluntness here but I can't imagine anything surviving cunnilingus from a chicken.  So yes, we may have a problem.*   We have names!  Because I know you were dying to know, Blondie is the biggest and most aggressive one who has a "blonde" head (which the innernet tells me just SCREAMS "cock"), Cognito is the other big one, whose name came from jokes about an incognito worm that she found hiding in the bedding, the one with the cross on her head is Donkey (because all donkeys have a cross on their withers and we enjoy Shrek quite a bit here), the one with the stripe on its head is Stripe (who initially appeared to be the leader; we also enjoy Gremlins), the one with the wee little speck on its head is Speck (also the smallest), and the last one is Geronimo (who prefers not to be held, thankyouverymuch, and will leap from great heights if you're not careful).  See?
  Figure Two: The pink athletic tape is what I use on my splint-y shins when I run, and is holding a piece of window screen in place through which the heater warms the chicks' Rubbermaid-tub temporary home.  Also I'm hoping it reminds them all to be girls.
title: the MFA gay problem

body: I seem to have acquired a bit of a...reputation...with our local CVS pharmacy.   It started with them screwing up on one of Hotter's immunosuppressant drugs and giving me the wrong one (he's on two) during Snowmageddon.  I had to go BACK out into the blizzard (the MFA Minivan has AWD but still, the South takes snow seriously) and they didn't have the correct drug in stock so I had to quickly have them transfer the prescription to Walgreen's and pay AGAIN (Hotter's immunosuppressants are covered by Medicare since they are related to his disability, and while it pays 80% of the cost and we are grateful, 20% of what those very necessary not-even-a-little-bit-optional drugs run each month is over $500) and I was...displeased.  I may have had The Crazy Eye a little bit.  I think I used the words "unacceptable" and "reckless disregard" and may have said something about CVS trying to make me a widow...it's kind of a blur .   I forget what it was next that they screwed us on, I think it was failing to have his OTHER immunosuppressant in stock; they ended up giving us the brand-name drug for the cost of the generic, and just recently Medicare screwed up massively in the process of transferring Hotter's prescription-drug supplement policy (for the drugs NOT related to any transplants) from Arctic Tundra to Ourstate.  This meant that there was a one-month gap in coverage (which was NOT supposed to happen) for the five or so non-transplant prescription drugs Hotter needs on a daily basis for things like blood pressure, reflux, and seizure control (it sounds like a lot, I know, but the barsteward is in better general health than I am most of the time).  I found this out at CVS while picking up a vital blood pressure medication and they were dismayed enough by my reaction (I promise I'm not scary or curse-y or ad hominem with the poor pharmacy employees but I do take the drugs that keep my husband alive rather seriously and money here is tight) that they gave me a month's worth of the drug at no cost "while this gets straightened out."   Today I had to pick up Hotter's seizure medication (very expensive), and I was fully expecting to pay out of pocket (not happily, but I was prepared for it) but took Hotter's new prescription drug supplement card (which just came in the mail and goes into effect on the first of the month) so that they could at least put the information on file.  CVS didn't realize I was aware of the situation, though, and I think they thought I was expecting the coverage to work as of today.   The pharmacist was visibly quaking when she came to the window to inform me that the drug Hotter needs to take twice a day so he doesn't have uncontrolled seizures was $230.00.  I was prepared for it to cost about $200.00, so maybe the extra $30.00 caused me to flash The Crazy Eye at the poor girl or something, I don't know, but she quickly stammered that she had put a discount card on his file so that his drugs would run through at cost until the new coverage kicked in and filled enough to get us to June first (when the new coverage kicks in), which would be...twelve bucks.   TWELVE BUCKS, Y'ALL!     I celebrated by going and getting some much-needed groceries and then came home and told Hotter what happened.  He laughed hard, and said "oh those POOR people!"   Crazy Eye for the win!

If you hate snakes, this is not the post for you.  Exit this way in an orderly fashion, please.   If not, scroll down..............   This is Poe.  He's a rat snake, and he's pretty impressive when he's stretched out to his full three and a half-ish feet, especially in the water.
  Figure One: Okay, YOU try taking a picture of a black snake swimming in a white bathtub sometime.   The problem, aside from the fact that I suck at photography, is that the mouse I bought for Poe to eat has taken over his tank and acquired a name (Balzac, which is high-falutin' for "the mouse teabags the damn snake non-stop and Mommy and Hotter can't stop giggling over this or grow up, apparently, ever").  On his second day here Balzac threw poor Poe out of the warm corner of their 55-gallon bachelor pad over the heater, and Poe moved into the paper-towel tube Hotter put in there for the mouse, probably because it functions as body-armor to keep the mouse's balls off his face.   In addition to being on a hunger strike that I forcibly broke with feeder fish and my gardening gloves (it wasn't pretty, y'all, and that's all I'm going to say about that), Poe has refused to come out of his tube for a week except for baths.
  Figure Two: Umm...yeah.  I don't know how he does it either.
  Figure Three: "Fiiiine but only if the water is nice and warm."   Once he's had his bath and spent some time hanging around my neck while I do dishes, Poe goes back into the tank (and back into a fresh tube) until the next time I feel like letting him swim in the tub while I clean the toilet.  
  Figure Four: This may constitute a cry for help.   I think Poe might be a little bit depressed.  Furthermore, I want to know where I can get a giant cardboard tube to hide in between warm baths, because I'm feeling a little blue myself.  How about you?

*   Obviously I did not get the new MFOrganics stuff posted last night. My bad.
*   Instead I went to bed before ten and slept ten hours straight. I needed that.
*   I still woke up and wanted to go burn down the nearest elementary school. That's not so awesome.
*   Little Child is home again today, has a physical and flu shot tomorrow morning bright and early, and goes to school tomorrow.
*   Hotter made a snide remark this morning (really? REALLY, DUDE? I mean, I factored in for my being extra-raw and wrathful and that was STILL a dickish thing to say). My outrage reached such epic proportions that rather than comment I grabbed my car keys and went OUT.
*   The XY picked that time to call and make it clear that his new leaf turned back over and decomposed into something smelling a lot like the manure tea I used last week on the winter garden. I may have to go to court soonish. Booooooooo...
*   After a few terse reminders to the XY to be civil I told him that I'd answered all of his questions three times already and would accept new ones via e-mail, hung up, and drove forty-five minutes into the country and picked up our processed deer from the Mennonite butcher-shop, and it was just the thing. Stepping into their cheery little facility was like going a hundred years and a thousand miles away from all of the things making me want to stab people. I dare you--I DOUBLE-DOG DARE YOU--to be grouchy when you're surrounded by plump, cheerful teenage girls with braids to their waists gossiping around meat counters while they make summer sausage. The mom clucked over my bandages and insisted on trying some of their acrylic gloves on to determine the best fit, then stuffed a handful of those into my cooler along with the meat. I bought three jars of local wild berry jams and left smiling.
*   In the hall on the way out there was a wall of morally-instructive pamphlets. Because no one was looking, I took one of each for the kitsch value (they're FABULOUS--fire and brimstone!). If you're friends with Hotter on the facespace then I apologize (he plans to post lines from the pamphlets daily as his status updates for the next month, and he'll do it, too--it just finished saying "boats and hos" for several months in a row).
*   Our deer, for those of you who were wondering, was a buck and we have eight two-pound summer sausages, nineteen pounds of frozen ground meat, and five tenderloins in the freezer plus two pounds of meat in the crockpot simmering. Either our buck was enormous and had some extra limbs or our butcher threw in some extras. The second option seems more likely and I'm OKAY WITH THAT. All of that meat only set us back eighty dollars for the processing. YES!
*   I have chili on that smells FANTASTIC and I'll be canning for the rest of the day. I need to keep my hands busy and my mind calm or I will seriously cut a bitch, Mennonites or no Mennonites. How are all of YOU?

body: *   We went to the Local Teaching Hospital today, and I hate that place.  I am always discombobulated after a trip there and invariably get lost either on the way, while there, or on the way home (but I am a grown-up and should be able to get my shit together).*   Hotter reshuffled all of my papers looking for an appointment reminder for today's appointment over the weekend and now I can't find the two prescriptions I had stashed in the desk area prior to washing my purse (one of which was for a 90-day fill of Ritalin, and they won't replace a lost script for a controlled substance) (although I should have put these somewhere safer, so that's my fault too).*   Hotter's labs.  Boo.  Booooo.  All over the place, inconsistent, and alarming (to me at least--the anesthesiologist pulled up his prior labs and said his kidney function always sucks like this, but I had to go and fetch the latest labs from the transplant center so that anesthesiology wouldn't stick him again unnecessarily and seeing them in black and white was...unsettling).  I am not a fan of that (but I already knew his kidney function was...suboptimal...and shouldn't worry if the doctors aren't worried).*   We were three minutes late for today's appointment, and it was my fault for circling the Local Teaching Hospital and trying to find street parking (I have an ongoing feud with the hospital valet service; they have an overinflated sense of authority and no, actually I will not get back into my vehicle, restart it, and back it up six inches so just deal you arseholes).  Which caused Hotter to get antsy and peevish, which made me anxious and pissy, and I should have taken into account that he is rather worried about this whole surgi-ma-callit-itis thing and caved sooner, so my bad really (and it's not his fault I have Baggage With Angry Men).*   The MFA Minivan has a sick and is at the mechanic as we speak getting a new drive-shaft.  Which: boo.  Just boo.  I know that Hotter only means to be helpful in reminding me that we ought to run a couple of errands, but I dropped the MFA Minivan off on the way back from the Local Teaching Hospital because the old drive shaft is noisy and scary and I know I have to do those other things, but killing the vehicle wouldn't help them get done (and I should have done them all sooner, I just haven't felt great the past few days and have no idea why).*   The hang-up key on my Blackberry is broken.  This is not new, but it's still aggravating as hell.*   I'm tired and grouchy and vaguely queasy, and Not In A Mood for my husband and minivan to try and drop dead on me today (or ever, ideally).  Someone tell me a funny, please.
title: peevish

body: Getting the older two MFA Children off to the schoolbus stop of a morning is quite the production.  Generally they wake up on their own at the arse-crack of dawn, and the rule here is that you may play video games until the parental alarm goes off UNLESS there is a dispute that awakens an adult before the alarm (in which case you are In Trouble).  After Hotter and I are up, we throw some breakfast on the table, harangue the older children to EAT EAT EAT, and lay their clothes out.  Big Child dresses himself, but Middle Child, who is pushing six...well, he can dress himself, but it's what his IEP terms an "emerging skill" and if we're short on time one of us has to help him while the other prepares and packs snack.   Helping Middle Child get dressed isn't always as simple as holding his pants out for him to step into and plopping a shirt over his head for him to stick his arms into.  Some days it's like that, but others he's spacey and weird, stimming and distracted, and he has poor "motor-planning" skills and "executive functioning" ability on a good day, which means that not only will he not dress himself, if he's in one of his moods, he won't even help.     When I say "won't even help," I mean that he will not pick his foot up to step into a pair of pants, and when you go to lift his foot and guide it into a pants-leg for him, he won't bend his knee (you kind of have to push at the back of his knee as you lift his ankle, and some days he won't compensate by balancing on his other leg or even necessarily reach out and hold onto your shoulder--some days he'll grab your hair or your face, and others he'll just topple over and yell at you afterward) or point his toes to get his foot through the pants-leg either.  He won't put his arms into his shirtsleeves or even lift them; you have to reach through the sleeve with one hand, shove his wrist up under the shirt with the other, and pull it through.  It's kind of like dressing an alternately rigid and noodle-floppy mannequin when he's spacing like that, and because all of my kids have hypermobile joints you also have to be careful not to hyperextend anything or bend it backward as you manipulate Middly into his clothing if he's having a noodle day; it's like he's neurologically impaired (okay, I guess it's not like that so much as that he is neurologically impaired, except that if he's focusing well he is capable of doing better, so I don't know) or has never worn clothes before.     And yet comprehensive testing reveals that Middle Child's cognitive abilities are in the gifted range.  Bygones.  Einstein couldn't tie his own shoes.   This morning Hotter was struggling to get Middle Child dressed, and Middle Child was being exceedingly unhelpful, and Big Child has standardized testing this week and was perseverating on how much trouble he'd be in if he missed the bus and was late, and after I finished bagging and packing the childrens' snacks I went over to help Hotter, who was clearly growing frustrated, with Middle Child, who was...I don't want to say "refusing" because that makes it sound like brattiness as opposed to a feature of a developmental disability, and "failing" makes it sound critical, let's just say..."abstaining from" participation.     The kid wasn't lifting his feet today and it was one minute until time for him to leave for the bus stop.   Since Hotter had already gotten the pants into position, I grabbed Middle Child under his arms and lifted him up to allow Hotter to slip the pants over Middly's feet, and Middly had been staring into space and was surprised by this.  So he exclaimed what I exclaim when I'm rendered otherwise speechless by something awful or frustrating or awfully frustrating, what slips out of my mouth when one of my children has harmed another, or someone has crapped their pants in public, or blurted out a Very Inappropriate Question in mixed company; in other words, he parroted the absolute worst thing I ever say in front of my children, what he hears me say perhaps once or twice a month when I'm at the very end of my rope:      "JESUS CHRIST!"   Hotter gazed first at Middle Child and then at me with something akin to horror (he later told me he thought I'd lose my junk on the kid for busting out with the JC; for all that I talk big smack on the innernets I raise my kids G-rated and they aren't even allowed to say "fart" or "crap" or "dang" unless it's Festivus, and while we are not Christian here, or any other religion, my kids also aren't allowed to use any deity-based expletives because I don't want them offending anyone), then when I collapsed laughing he joined me (so did Middle Child).  When I could speak again and was past any danger of peeing myself (three kids, y'all) I informed Middle Child that while we were laughing because we hadn't expected him to say that, it wasn't something he ought to say at school, and then we stuffed him into his pants and sent the children out the door.   I guess I ought to stop saying Jesus Christ, too, but JESUS CHRIST that was funny!

body:
*   I read a post by someone extolling the virtues of Swagbucks and decided to give it a try. I'm not like, SUGGESTING it to anyone just yet (although that link would purportedly give me some kind of referral-credit-thingy if you signed up through it, in the name of disclosure) because I don't know if it sucks or not. I'll let y'all know (I'm still in mourning over the demise of Bing; I love me some e-Bates but they don't fill the hole in my heart).
*   I officially have the cold that's been working its way through the house and am not at all pleased with it. Hotter's getting better though, so that's a relief (even though he annoying shakes these things faster than anyone else in the house, technically there IS the whole organ transplant recipient thing, and so I worry, although if this is him with a weakened immune system then probably he could eat the flu and crap a cure before his transplants, just sayin).
*   Once again all hail the g-tube. Little Child was snoring so loudly last night that Hotter and I bounded out of bed and ran to check on the dogs in their crate, convinced that someone was either puking or gnawing their way out. No, it was the five-year-old. SNORING. He's already had his adenoids out and this is probably just a cold, so I gave him some OTC decongestant (cheap store-brand, with dye in--this "no dietary restrictions, passed all food challenges, gastroparesis less severe than in previous winters" thing NEVER GETS OLD) and didn't have to wake him up to do it. Not that I'm suggesting you demand a g-tube for your perfectly healthy child or anything, but since my kid needs one anyway this is a definite perk.
*   Today I'm supposed to find out just how badly Things Unbloggable will suck in the months to come. One benefit of being on my deathbed with this wretched cold is that I keep forgetting to worry about that. Win?
*   I'm choosing to be grateful to our frienemy Stalky McPsychopants for reminding me that the walllls have eaarrrrs. Because I might have been tempted to share some of The Unbloggable above with y'all without Stalky's reminder that despite the innernet being filled with more good than bad, especially in MY opinion (I mean, I met Hotter via the innernet, after all), there's still the odd wackaloon out there squeezing their poodle, eating their Lean Cuisine, stroking their sense of superiority through their panties with the salad tongs and fantasizing about a Mommyblogger suit made of REAL MOMMYBLOGGERS. The Unbloggable isn't even all that interesting, so don't feel like you're missing out or anything.
*   Temerity Jane is always funny, but this? Specifically the third item on her list? YES! I'd even go so far as to say that, as with masturbation, there are generally two kinds of people in regards to drama: those who love it and those who lie about loving it. Case in point, Sitemeter says you're ALL going to the hot place (I got more unique visitors yesterday than I generally do in a week, which was part of why I took that shit down; I don't want anyone's first impression of me to be the worst I've probably put out here in a year).
*   Have y'all seen this dude's blog? Charlie's pretty awesome. Y'all know I'm a sucker for a man who cooks, but he's also hilarious. Plus I hear his girlfriend's kind of a big deal, although being half-dead and on a lot of cold medicine, I was halfway through his archives before I connected the dots. Hotter and I both got some good laughs out of the way he turns a phrase in describing certain aspects of cooking, plus he mentioned by name the big, canonical, pretentious French cookbook that lives on Hotter's desk so I think my personal chef has a little mancrush. Hee!
*   I just discovered that my oldest? Is freaking hilarious. I mean, I kind of knew this, but...he wrote this Thanksgiving survival guide geared toward a target audience of TURKEYS...Hotter and I were crying, we were laughing so hard. I need to either figure out how to connect my old print/copy/scan/fax doohickey to the laptop or take pictures. It's THAT FUNNY.
*   Speaking of funny, I have some HILARIOUS friends, particularly him and her. Thanks for the laughs, y'all :)
title: in other random news

body:
Okay, so karma (or a pissy former friend, same diff) bit me in the ass for being ugly earlier today and SOMEone has raised some questions on the Twitter. Not that any of y'all who are likely reading this asked, but if the "anonymous" stalker would kindly post their name and address in the comments I will happily send them the following to prove I'm legit (the rest of you may take my word for it, or not--up to you):
*   A copy of my Middle Child's IEP, since they (disturbingly) know my kid's name and where he goes to school anyway. The official conditions listed as the reason for the IEP are PDD-NOS (one of the five pervasive developmental delays collectively referred to by most folks as autism), ADHD, and a connective tissue disease under "other, medical." Yes, he's mainstreamed, and I'm proud as hell of that. Did you honestly think they still just chucked all of the kids with special needs in a "resource-room" holding tank together?
*   A copy of my W-2's, with my employers' information redacted to prevent further harassment (yes, Virginia, I have a job/jobs, but I'm deliberately vague about what I do and for whom online because a very few people on the innernet are assholes who like to try and screw with my life).
*   A copy of my final decree of divorce to prove that my child support amount has remained unchanged since the date of my separation from my ex-husband (Stalky McPsychopants WAS correct in that my income from the XY has changed, because I stopped receiving spousal support when I remarried, as is pretty much standard--as with a lot of things they've said about me they clearly know more about me than anyone that insane really ought to, and are sorta-almost-if-you-squint right, but not quite, I mean they got my NAME 1/3 wrong, FFS, and know jack-all about my life from the date I cut them out of the e-mail updates I used to send to a few friends before reopening this blog) (also, wow, what a crappy former friend--all that time you seriously didn't know my full NAME?).
*   A copy of the letter I got from my psychiatrist in preparation for a court date refuting the XY's claims that I suffer from Borderline Personality Disorder (since I'm sharing, my offical diagnosis from him reads something along the lines of "dysphoria without associated mania indicative of bipolar disorder, situational anxiety, and adult ADD [...] NO evidence of borderline personality" although I haven't looked at that letter in over a year so don't quote me on the exact wording) (further psychobabble mumbo-jumbo further down the page, loosely paraphrased, indicates that since my lifetime total sexual partners could fit in my minivan with seatbelts to spare, I don't cut or otherwise self-harm, and I don't steal or exhibit other signs of flexible morals I don't fit the criteria for Borderline Personality Disorder, unless the latest revision of the DSM has changed to expand the diagnostic criteria to include "intensely disliked by her ex-husband and a handful of innernet whack-jobs").
   Stalky? Wanna take me up on it? Or are you too chicken to "out" yourself to me since I believe you've moved a time or two in the years since I've had any truck with you? Since I moderate comments, I hereby pledge that if you DO take me up on it, I won't even show the whole wide innernet YOUR address (although you've threatened to show them mine; guess this is the one place where having a stable enough life that I don't move at least every year makes me the loser of the two of us).
   Non-stalkies? I also wanted to say that while yes, the innernet has helped me out financially, if you donated to Isis's veterinary treatment fund and would like a no-questions-asked refund, please send me an e-mail from the address associated with your PayPal account and let me know, and rest assured that I won't call you out publicly or anything like that. I think 99.9% of the small population likely to read said whack-job's rantings who knows me at all, or even anyone who doesn't know me but has half a brain can recognize them as bullshit (I mean really? They claim to have been privy to the thoughts of the police officers who came to my house on my wedding night as a result of unbloggability? WOW, one of y'all whose guts they don't hate should ask them for some winning lottery numbers since they're all-knowing like that, or maybe they're just full of shit and their story wouldn't survive an undergraduate fiction workshop...also see "blacklisted by all junior colleges in the state" because REALLY? You think the community college system here has the funding to maintain a universal blacklist based on...well I don't know, the accusations from your Twitter-stream? HAHAHAHAHA!), and I did my best to be transparent by posting pictures of vet bills, prescriptions, and even my poor dog's mangy arse, but still. I don't want anyone who extended a helping hand my way to feel like they were ripped off or lose trust in the innernet as a whole as a result, because that was some damned beautiful goodwill and I wouldn't want to ruin it for the next person who needs a hand (also, just to be clear, I was not hinting in this post about Christmas presents for the kids, I will handle that because I am a big girl and nobody ever died of not getting a fucking Christmas present, so really, I've got that in case any of you thought I was asking for anything; sometimes I just need to vent okay?) (and Stalky is correct, we don't truly celebrate Christmas here in that we're not Christian, but my kids go to public school in America and therefore want to celebrate the retail holiday like everyone else: we exchange gifts and put up a goddamn tree, yes we do: SUE ME).
   I took my Twitter-stream private for a while so that I can vent, but as I did so noticed the following on my homepage there (here is where I end this on a bright note and go to bed):
 Figure One: Fuck the haters, I think this means I win the entire innernet. Good night.

body:
*   I can't take a knee anymore! My knees suck, and if I stayed down 
here until things calmed down I wouldn't get back online before BlogHer 
and I'd miss out on all the blogsturbation (tm mom, natch) and...well, 
anyway.

*   What's that? No, of course I didn't get things all good and 
transitioned over to the new-to-me blackberry from the previous, 
dead-to-me piece of equipment. It would be passésauce to go on a 
technology fast and then play with a new electronic gadget that way, and
 doing something that ironic would be all kinds of 
"writing-a-song-about-funny-things-and-calling-it-irony-without-knowing-what-that-means"
 so I didn't set it up. Or, alternately, I couldn't switch it until I 
paid the bill but the XY was late with the support check because he 
doesn't deserve a head and then I got pissed off at Comcast and canceled
 our innernet service, you know, as you do. Or possibly if I set it up I'd forget to deal with the innernet problem since blackberry=innernet and I used to think I was the fitter candidate to put the innernet back together again, until it became apparent that no one at Comcast deserves a head today and Hotter is SO much better at dealing with assholes than I am.

*   Yeah, when I put it all self-deprecating like that it almost sounds 
like I expected me to accomplish anything, but my "Summer of Duh" is not
 yet over with. It's possible it could have been, but my next 
appointment with Dr. Shrink where I could confess that I went without 
Ritalin all summer due to losing the prescription (yeah, my husband lost
 it, but y'all he has brain damage and I should never have left it 
unguarded or ignored him when he said he couldn't keep me company while I
 dug outside because he was looking for something--that's like telling 
your three-year-old where the scissors are without asking why; total 
supervision fail and my fault, not Hotter's--he just wanted to make some
 paperdolls really) was in the Blackberry...

*   Puppies. They're assholes, really. I know I said it was just like 
having a baby and I still stand by that statement, it's just that when 
you have a baby if you say they're an asshole people look at you like 
you don't deserve a head but with puppies you can be all "she sucks, Imma 
take her to a nice farm where she can run free and kick her out of the 
car" and everyone's just like "HAHAHA! THE FARM!" Animals are awesome because 
people aren't all "shut up, sanctity of human life, blah blah blah" 
except PETA, but I'm already dead to them because I find OTHER animals, 
like the ones that don't eat and roll in shit, delicious. Bygones!*   I did at least perfect my Better Than Adultery cookie recipe, and if
 this was an inspirational Lifetime Movie and I didn't lack about 
eleventy health department permits and people were willing to shell out 
what I lose in overhead (HAVE you ever priced raw, organic macadamia 
nuts? Well OKAY THEN) I would sell them to pay the puppy's veterinary 
bills and still go to BlogHer in style, or else maybe Energizer would 
sponsor me and I'd use the whole $2,000 to bake Better Than Adultery 
cookie for everyone at the conference! Shut up, I said "if this was an 
inspirational Lifetime Movie," which totes leaves a loophole so that if I
 win the real-life contest I can be all "yeah, well, but mama really

body: One of the things G-Money, our family therapist, likes to harp on is how I don't express anger via conventional means and blah blah bad example blah blah communicationFAIL. Some of you regular readers might find this kind of hard to believe, because I do rant a bit now and then, but...okay hold the phone, I just went archive-surfing for examples of rants and angry tirades on here and...wow. Maybe pharmacists just make me hostile?    Anyway, it happened again and ExpressScripts? MORONS. I am required by my insurance plan to fill maintenance prescriptions through them, and not only do they invariably screw up, but they also have THE most BYZANTINE phone tree, and if you get through that (plan for at least twenty minutes there) you get to talk to a bunch of rude, intellectually-deficient mouthbreathers who are more interested in telling you how whatever they've screwed up is all your fault (NO, NOT THIS TIME, NOT EVEN LAST TIME ASSHOLES) than in righting things. Customer service: ur doin it rong.   So yesterday I was on the phone with them trying to find out just where the fuck mah crazy pills were; I take four prescriptions per day and while one of them is a synthetic replacement of a very vital hormone that like, makes your metabolism function and shit, it's the crazy pills I worry most about running out of. Because nobody likes teh crazy and also because if you stop taking this particular kind of crazy pill cold turkey you'll get a wicked blinding headache and (according to the on-call doctor I spoke with one time when my luggage got lost and I had to get things replaced) HAVE A SEIZURE.   I have no interest in experiencing a seizure. I've seen those and they look unfun.   So I placed an order two weeks before I was due to run out of meds, and called yesterday after taking my last crazy pill to find that these idiots had apparently run the wrong card number or something (my best guess since I KNOW that account had money in it, and also that if it did not the bank would have covered the charge and assessed me a hefty fee) and...canceled my order. Which they would now have to re-enter, with the six-day processing time and shipping and...unacceptable. Absolutely unacceptable, not my fault, and I don't have a sense of humor about the seizure thing at ALL, let alone the whole "now you must call eleventy doctors and deal with THEIR phone trees and get a replacement script to purchase out of pocket" angle...which led to my saying to a customer "service" representative yesterday (with my family in the minivan with me, although I was parked, not driving, while having this conversation) "NONONO, STOP TALKING AND GET ME YOUR SUPERVISOR, I NEED TO TALK TO SOMEONE WHO DESERVES TO HAVE A HEAD!"   "MOMMY! Are you okay? That's pretty...dark...for you!" Big Child exclaimed, clearly trying not to laugh. Hotter just went ahead and busted out laughing.   Yes, honey. I'll be poorer after this is all sorted out, and have the Crazy Eye for the rest of the day, but I'm okay. And for the record? NOBODY at ExpressScripts deserves to have a head.

body:
*   This morning I spent eighty minutes trapped in the exam room of a pediatric endocrinologist with my ex-husband and a very bored Little Child. The XY finally made that appointment to have Little Child's growth evaluated, and I wanted to make sure he didn't try to railroad the doctor into skipping any steps in the evaluation (you might think that's paranoid of me, but you haven't seen the XY in action--when he runs out of his ADD meds I've watched him convince doctors who have never met him to prescribe them without even seeing medical records, which is supposed to be impossible because they're amphetamines, but he's REALLY CHARMING and VERY PERSUASIVE and DOES NOT HANDLE "NO" WELL AT ALL and nine times out of ten he gets his way), give the wrong kid's medical history, or lie about anything to try and get Little Child on growth hormones. It turns out he tried to do all three of those things, so it's a good thing I went, but good LORD I hate that motherfucker! I forgot how he puts me down and attempts to discredit me in public. This is the first time he's had the chance to do it without a cop or a judge present (he won't do it in front of Hotter, either, because he still has that "must be liked" thing going on with Hotter and doesn't WANT anything from Hotter, and I just refuse to be alone with him) since the divorce, and I set a new precedent of pausing the conversation, turning to him with a confused expression, and asking him what on Earth he's talking about then pointing out how inappropriate it is for him to correct me on, say, my own medical history. This embarrassed him (and that is about the worst thing you can do to the XY, embarrass him IN FRONT OF SOMEONE) enough that he shut his fool hole, but I got an earful as soon as all medical providers left the room again, in front of Little Child. That sucked. Did I mention I hate the XY? Okay then. The long and short (no pun intended) of it is that the doctor feels like something MAY be up with Little Child's growth, and took blood for labwork and a bone-age x-ray today, and we'll follow up in five months to see how Little Child is growing according to the same equipment to rule out human error/equipment differences, and go from there. By that time school will be back in session, and Hotter plans to come along for backup, and hopefully I'll be doing well enough at the new job to afford a lawyer if I need one, because at that point if the XY wants to try and force growth hormones on Little Child for non medically-necessary reasons we will end up back in court over it.
*   So this morning was just a real mood-ruiner for me, and the cherry on top is that the hospital where the endocrinologist's office was located is in the neighborhood where I grew up, which I avoid going near if at all possible. The XY knows that, and there ARE other office locations (I checked online), so fuck him, again, some more, because I think he was hoping I would chicken out of going along (typically if he is willing to take one of the children to the doctor I just remove myself from he equation to avoid unpleasantness, but this is the first specialist appointment he's been willing to cover and he knew I wanted to be present). I am kind of a mess now, honestly, from the residual feelings brought up by the recent drama with The Narcissist, her family doing a drive-by on my blog, and that bullshit obituary, and the last thing I really needed was to spend eighty minutes in a room with ANOTHER narcissist in the neighborhood of my hellish childhood. As soon as I finish catching up on my work for Temp Agency #2 I plan to hit the fitness machines at the YMCA with my guided meditations playlist and try to exercise (spelling and, therefore, pun INTENDED) my demons.
*   Why do things I want always have to go on clearance when I'm broke? That is a fucking fantastic price on a vented beesuit, but by the time I get paid by The New Job and catch our bills up I'm sure they'll all be gone. 
*   I have a few other things I would like to complain about, too, but need to get back to work and would probably feel like a whiner after I've gotten my head straight again. 
*   I really need to get my head straight, because I have orienation tomorrow at The New Job and want to be my most fabulous self for that.
*   How are all of YOU?

The MFA Garden is really coming along, and is finally to the point where there is something to see!  Here's what we've got growing so far, along with some gratuitous chicken coop and chick photos (and a damn mole that was eating the hostas by the strawberry bed, and yes, I caught it with my--gloved--hands and yes, I released the stupid thing far, far away from the garden; don't believe me?  Watch for yourself):
  Yup, right in the FRONT yard, because otherwise the deer will eat everything.  Stupid deer!
  The two beds of potatoes are different ages--this is the younger one.
  That's Pablo the poblano pepper (above).  Yeah, I named the pepper.
  The bush beans are starting to flower.  I can't wait to start picking; fresh green beans are da bomb!
  Yeah, that's some runty spinach around the edges; it keeps the slugs off the other stuff.
  I don't know what's wrong with 3/4 of the tomatoes above.  Any ideas?
  No clue why the sunflowers above aren't all the same height either. The spinach on the left side is sparse-looking because we ate it in a salad with dinner tonight.
  You can never have too much corn, too many peas, or too many sunflowers--at least I can't.
  This corner is a work in progress; there are columbines, poppies and phlox sprouting between the hostas (the far left hosta is the one the damn mole got to before I got him), which look pathetic because I divided them up from one big one our neighbor gifted us with.  You can see the edges of the sod-clumps at the bottom.  It'll look much better next year.  Any guesses what the plants in the darker-colored soil are?
  If you guessed strawberries, you were right!  I planted them less than two weeks ago, and didn't think we'd get any fruit this year but they've started to flower.  Yay!
 I found this little fern under the front hedgerow when I pruned it; you can't see it in the overview shot of the corner-in-progress but I <3 it. 
  This is one of two raised cedar planters we bought; the other one isn't assembled yet because the MFA Marriage was sorely tested by the assembly of the first one.  Also I am totally revoking Hotter's penis, because I had to do all the screwing.  *rimshot*
 These are cucumber vines (with peas at the bottom) that we're training up part of the front porch.  The medical professionals and special-needs parents among you may have noticed that I'm tying them up with Surgilast.  Heh.  Also, Hotter calls the cucumber vines "Hulk winkie vines" because it slays me every time. 
  
The chicken coop!  We bought it from an e-Bay seller and it arrived it two big, flat boxes.  Our mail carrier already hated us anyway.
  Damn mole.  I wanted to kill the bugger, but Hotter moped until I released him.  You really should go and watch that video I linked to at the top (yes, that's me in the video) of the damn mole's release; I hate moles but their diggers are pretty impressive and you can see them in use!
